text: Very nice and smooth porter, drinks easily and hits the taste buttons right away, not a surprise it has a high rating, it has everything a good porter should have.

12floz bottle (BOD/BBD?: 11.30.2016) that I bought as part of a mix-six for $9. Appears in my pint glass nearly black in color with a small amount of light brown head. Roasted malts are strong with dark chocolate, licorice, and touches of smoke. This leads to sharp bitter roast flavor and chalky heavy body. I find it too be overloaded in one way, so it wont make my seek after porter list.
Bottle from Voldby. Pours pitch black with a brown head. Aroma and taste is roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, dark fruits, licorice. Full body. Soft carbonation. Oily texture. Bitter roasted finish.

Black color with a fine beige head. Ok lacing. Ok intensity in the aroma. Medium body and fizzy carbonation level (as usual for barrel aged beer). Easy to drink. Ok balance between sweetness and bitterness. Semi dry ending. Wood/oak, chocolate, roast and coffee in the flavor. Nice easy drinkable stout with a fine character. Just a bit to thin mouth feeling.[Bottle from a trade with Sigmund]

Bottle from Saveur biere. Pours black with tan foam head. Aroma is dark chocolate, Berry, coffee, cherry with piney hop background. Flavour is a creamy dark bittering chocolate. Coffee bean aftertaste. Viscous bitter hop finish. Delicious.

Pours opaque petroleum black. Small beige head. Big coffee, chocolate, earth, citrus hops on nose. Medium body. Powerful flavour. Rich roasted malts, coffee, chocolate. Decent hopping. Long bitter finish. Perfect porter (or stout?).-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Big hoppy bitter bomb of a porter, chock full roasty unsweetened chocolate, deep raisin and mocha notes underneath. Mild sweetness perks up as it warms, and a lengthy bitter finish adds a nice spiteful fade. Surprisingly good.

Very dark, black even, with a 1 inch brown-tan thick, creamy-looking head that recedes gradually, leaving lacing slipping down the glass. Smoaky, roasted malt aroma with hints of sweet raisins. Moderate mouth feel. Initial taste hit is somewhat sweet, but it transitions quickly to a lightly roasted flavor. The initial flavor has a character I cant quite pin down... almost minty, but not really - maybe it is the wood others mention. The balance is provided with mild to somewhat more than mild bittering in the finish. Dont be mislead by the name; this is a porter/stout in all but name. Decent.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2017 Bottle. Pours pitch black with no head whatsoever. Burnt coffee, toasted malts, dark cocoa, roasted rye, molasses, burnt rubber, smoky notes. Full mouthfeel. There is some hops going on. Extremely good.

Bottle at home. Taste of dark rye bread in toaster, coffee and bitter orange peels. Some hints of bubblegum.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared at home. Black with tan head. Sweet deep roasted chocolate malts, barley, chocolate, coffee candy, molasses, burnt match heads, black pepper (the aroma, not the spiciness), something fruity like brier. Over medium sweet and deep roasty, almost ashy, ground bitter. Over medium body, soft carbonation. Slick feel. Nice roasty bitter sweet finish.

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro. Almost black with light brown head. Licorice, dark chocolate, sweet malts, light ash, some dusty nuts, cardboard, blackberries. Medium sweet and bitter. A bit over medium bodied with slick oily thick feel and soft carbonation. Nice!
Szép fekete szín, habja alig van, szénsav sem sok. Étcsokoládés, pörkölt malátás, közepesen keserű. A háttérben gyümölcsös aromák húzódnak meg. Nagyon selymes. Kandalló mellett a legjobb ital.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Mega fajne połączenie żywicznych chmieli i wyraźnej paloności.

Barwa czarna, z brunatnymi przebłyskami.
Aromat mało intensywny, głównie popiołowa paloność, nuty melasy i trawiastego chmielu.
W smaku pełne, z wyraźną palonością nutami kawy. Czekolada gorzka w tle, słodkie kakao. Finisz wytrawny, lekko wysuszający i popielniczkowy.
Bottle from tavour. Burst of roasty cold pressed coffee and coco nibs. Cant quite place this as a porter but Ill go along with it l. Nice hops interplayed with this. Quite unique.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours black with tan head. 
Aroma chocolate, coffee, caramel, licorice, some fruit. 
Taste chocolate caramel sweets, roasty coffee bitters. 
Mouthfeel full, thick. 
Great brew.

Pici, gyorsan eltűnő hab, vöröses árnyalatú fekete szín. Illata pörkölt malátás, fekete csokis, halvány aszalt gyümölcsösséggel. Pörkölt malátás, csokis ízvilág, finoman belesimuló aszalt gyümölcsös aromákkal, hosszú, pörkölt malátás lecsengéssel. Közepes keserűjét a pörkölés adja. Közepesen testes, enyhén szénsavas. Nagyon jó egyensúllyal rendelkező, nagyon finom sör.

Noire dense, petit collet dense de fines bulles.
Aromes puissants, chocolat noir, caramel, cafe, liqueur
Plutot mince mais les malt rotis tapissent genereusement le palais pour une finale longue amere et un peu seche.

On tap @ IBF Pub Edition 2016, Milano. Il gusto al naso rintraccia liquirizia, orzo tostato e caffè. Il cappello dal colore marrone castagno è di schiuma compatta, cremosa, aderente ed ha una buona tenuta. La grandezza delle bollicine è medio-fine. Al piano inferiore il colore è scuro impenetrabile. Il corpo è strutturato non pesante. La struttura è di spessore. Lamaro è medio. Lintensità gustativa è elevata e la persistenza gustativa è buona. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono lunghe. Il finale è lungo, secco, pulito e complesso. Il retrogusto è intenso. Laroma in bocca riporta sentori di miele, biscotto, agrumi, caffè e liquirizia.
Roast and dark chocolate with some caramel. Black pour with good head and lacing. Bittersweet finish. Nice drink. Tap at Fatheads.

Bottle from City Swiggers, Manhattan, New York, USA. A black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Roasty, malty, chocolate aroma. Tastes roasty, malty, chocolate, some coffee, slightly sweet with a bitter finish. Nice porter from Dark Horse.

12fl oz bottle at home from Only Good Beer, Budapest. Nose is cocoa, vanilla, roasted malt, dark berries. Body is pitch black, head is small, brownish, creamy, average lasting, good lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, dark chocolate, dark roasted coffee, old wood, hint of smoke. Light sweet, medium to heavy bitter. Finish is long lasting roasty medium to heavy bitter, later rather hoppy. Full body, oily thick sticky texture, nearly flat carbonation. Quite easy dessert beer, strong flavor, very tasty, great one.
Bottle, 355 ml from Beergium. Shared with JFK10000 and Miro. Pours black, medium beige head. Hoppy, roasted malts, coffee, chocolate. Sweetish. Finishes dry bitter. Medium bodied.

Pours dark, opaque black-brown, with a creamy, coffee tinted head. Aroma is dark roasted grains, chocolate, slightly sweet. Taste carries the aroma features, with a finish of dark toast. Palate is has a richness without being heavy, or cloying. Overall a well balanced porter, with extremely drinkable.

Aroma:

Slight/medium aroma of malts, caramel, chocolate, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a slight dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, caramel and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Sadly, the aroma is nowhere near as intense. Almost a smokey flavour, but it misses hops to get this completely carved in stone. Great and deliciously tasting beer overall.

On tap at RCBW 2016. Black liquid. Thin beige head on top. Nutiness, vanilla, sweetness in the aroma. Dark chocolate, lactic notes, bitterness and cocoa nibs in the middle. Hints of coffee. Quite intensive dry bitterness in the end. Cocoanibs in the aftertaste. Rather medium bodied, well drinkable porter.

Bottle picked up at France 44 and consumed on the Thursday before a Labor Day vacation. Deeper brown, nearly black color with tan head. Attractive looking ale. Aroma is predominantly sweet with chocolate notes coming through in tandem with roasty, coffee characteristics. Taste continues to lean on roasted malt notes with plenty of chocolate presence. There is a nice caramel quality that helps fill out the dessert-like nature of this one. Mouthfeel is soft and creamy. Slight alcohol burn towards the finish. Notes of bittersweet chocolate round out the aftertaste. Very high quality porter.

12 oz. bottle sample at WCDs 2016 distributor expo, displaying a black/brown hue, a fluffy layer of brownish tan head froth, and foamy spots of lacing. The nose was roasted, light smoke, cocoa, and light coffee. Medium bodied, with soft carbonation, the taste added a heightened, roasted, earthy, and tannic astringency that presented almost a little too much bite considering my perception of the body, and the modest mouthfeel of mellowing malt. Somewhere between a Black IPA and a Porter. Otherwise, fairly satisfying.
Pours pitch black, small head. Sweet caramely aroma, malts, choco. coffee, toffee. Intense coffee background with some sweetish creamy notes. Moderate bitterness at the end. Really well ballanced.

Bottle. Harrogate Fine Wine. Very dark, cola brown. Swirl and thin ring of tan. Nose has deep, rich, tangy roast. Some burnt ends. Hints of dark berry. Notes of coffee bean and charred wood. Taste is tangy, fruity, woody bitter. Light sweetness on the lips. Decent body. Bitter tang. Long, tangy, fruity bitter finish. Very nice.

Dark black pour, with a thin brown head. Aroma is of chocolate, roasted malts and caramel. Full bodied, nice mouthfeel. Roast flavor, milk chocolate. Great, chocolatey finish. Very nice body and flavorful.
Bottle at hopaholic. Pitch black colour, small white head. Nose is coffee, light booze, chocolaty. Taste is medium bitterness nice roasted malts. Nice.
Wow Great beer,long lasting huge coffee finish, coffee is everywhere, beer is thick oily and makes you feel happy!

Bardzo dobre piwo, tylko nie wiem, w jakiej kategorii powinienem je rozpatrywać - jako black ale czy porter? W aromacie kawa z czekoladą i ciemne palone słody tworzą bardzo przyjemną kompozycję. W smaku dochodzi do tego lekko owocowa goryczka, trochę alkoholu, ale gładko ułożonego. [Tap, ZUP]

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2016 Tap (ZUP, Wroclaw). Black colour, beige head. Roasty, coffee, chocolate in aroma, quite intensive. Similar in the taste with small fruits hint. Bitterness medium to high, roasty with alcohol notes which scratches a bit in the throat but in nice way. Really good, full body and quite drinkable beer. Beer is definitely dry but with small sweetness in aftertaste to compensate big roasty bitterness.

13/07/2016 @home - 33cl bottle from Bierhalle Deconinck.
Black colour with small tanned head. Nose is dark malts, cocoa, caramel. Taste is roasted malts, mocha, chocolate, caramel, bitter hops, dry bitter roasted ending
Daft. Pours black. Aroma and taste are bitter coffee, roasted malts, and some pine.
Smell is dark malt with some Licorice and alcohol, taste is lightly bitter...dark dark malt flavor but not sweet...some depth but not a lot...mostly coffee taste...black as night appearance..

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2016 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pours black with tight brown head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee and dark chocolate, nutty and slightly hoppy. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, walnut and dark chocolate and dry bitter, hoppy finish.
Smells nutty. Inky black with tan head. Grabs the glass as you drink. Thick mouth feel. Leads with roasted chocolate and g finishes with fresh rye breadthat lingers bitter
Pours tar black with aroma of roasted malt, licorice, and chocolate. Roasted malt flavor with licorice, hint of vanilla, and chocolate. Solid lacing. Very nice.

Jet black pour with a frothy brown head. Aroma was rich cocoa, roasted malt, melted candy bar, vanilla. Flavors were robust with roasty malt, cocoa, nougat, bittersweet lingering finish. Mouthfeel was on the plus side for an ABV of 7.5, moderate carbonation. Probably the best straight forward porter I have had. Executed to perfection, everything you could want from the style.
12 oz bottle from the sampler case. OK I guess, but nothing outstanding. I expected more from the pitch trying to sell this beer as something unique.

On tap at Brunzies (10/20/15). Malty, smoky, molasses tang. Between a stout and a Schwarzbier. Dark black with thin tan head. Medium body with medium carbonation. Rich nutty flavor with molasses and burnt bitter character. Strong finish with nutty bitter after.

Bottle (Erzbierschofs (Bern)); pours nearly black with a tan head; aroma of coffee, pine, roasted malt, and hint of chocolate; taste has a touch of bitterness with coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, and pine; finish is roasty and bitter; nice beer
Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Blackish pour with a tan head. Notes of smoke, tar, ash, heavy roast, light coffee and some sweet dark malts.
Drank 22-3-2016 while writing in my diary. The beer is quite bitter, but has a good body. The aftertaste is somewhat thick, more balanced and rich.

Lukt: Kaffe, bek, lakris, sjokolade.
Utseende: Sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum.
Smak: Kaffe, lakris og mørk sjokolade.
Hvor: Kjø[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Kvadrat, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Untapped Erik.

Aromas of roasted and some coffee. A little weak aroma compared to the taste. Taste is heavy roasted, close to smoked and some coffee. Nice bitterness. A nice porter!
Good. Something a little funky in the aftertaste but it kind of grows on you as you drink it.

Il nome non tradisce quanto appare nel bicchiere: infatti, si veste completamente di nero, come una notte senza luna nel profondo di una grotta; una bella schiuma compatta, cremosa, di color marroncino e dallammirevole persistenza ci fa compagnia. Laroma è interessante: malto tostato, caffè, cioccolato, un leggero tocco piccante e note erbacee di luppolo. In bocca esprime una discreta intensità: si chiamano subito presenti amaro ed acidità da caffè, a seguire malti tostati, liquirizia ed anice. Luppolo che fornisce ulteriore amaro, decisa carbonazione, finale asciutto, corpo medio-pieno.

Bottle @ home
Clear dark brown, chocolate brown head
A hint of smoked bacon, roasetd malts, marcipan with liquor, very rich and pleasent aroma
Thick harmonious rich taste, burned bread, coal, herbaceous long bitter ending.
Bottle from secret santa Saeglopur, many thanks! Liquorice, coffee, spices, grass, pine, caramel, nutmeg. Full bodied, nice lingering espresso bitter finish.

03.02.2016, 12 oz bottle @ home:
Small light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet roasted, dark sugar, minerals, dark malts, grass, caramel, hops, butterscotch, coffee, licorice. Taste is dry roasted, weeds, dark malts, burnt caramel, hops, bark, minerals, harsh coffee, licorice, paper. Longlasting harsh bitterness, watery mouthfeel. Not my cup of tea.

0,33 bottle purchased at the Hoppy imp. in Greece, consumed few months after in Kosovo. Black pour, brownish little foam with little retention and lacing. Nose: basically what you expect from an American black beer, roasted malts, coffee, grassy-herbal a bit piney which results in a combination of incense and floral notes. Mouth: the coffee is partially covered by the bitter character of this porter, the after taste results in a bit of licorice, anice too. Very interesting.
Dark black. Nose is dark roasted malts and chocolate. Taste follows, fairly malty. Expected this to be a black IPA with more bitter hops for some reason, but this is a solid porter.

Bottle at Heathers (thanks baby). Brownish-black pour, thin espresso looking head, nose is bakers chocolate, coffee, malt, roast. Soft carbonation, slick mouth feel, mildly sweet with pleasant balancing bitterness. Tasty.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2016 American robust porter generously shared by Jan of Weerspannige Brouwers. Thin but more or less stable, pale greyish beige head over a very dark, hazy mahogany beer, as good as black in appearance. Aroma of coffee grounds, bitter chocolate, pine resin, green peppercorns, black tea, cured meat, toasted brown bread, caramel, dried leaves, nutmeg, wormwood, soy sauce, dried porcini, black olive, haemoglobin. Umami onset, meaty and dried seaweed-like with a restrained candied date sweetness underneath as well as a salty soy sauce touch, soft carbo, oily, very smooth, full but slightly metallic mouthfeel, toasted and nutty malt bittersweetness ending in more roasted bitterness, a bit ashy even, spicy hops supporting this end bitterness and a dash of warming alcohol. Not sure if this qualifies as a typical porter, though, but regardless, this is a great example of American craft brewing.

Near black opaque body. Viscous with an oily, beige collar. Roast and chocolate scents leap out. Piney hop character emerges as the beer is allowed to warm a bit. Nice flavor. Medium bodied. Bitterness is gentle on the palate. Solid.
Bottle. Black, slight head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, slight sweetness, liquorice. Taste is smooth, fairly complex, chocolate, liquorice, coffee
Dunkelbraun mit kaum vorhandener Schaumkrone. Röstmalzig, bitter, Kaffee, Mokka, Bitterschokolade, etwas Karamell, dunkle Früchte, langer Abgang.

Pours an opaque very, very dark brown with a quickly fading tan head. Robust dark roasted malt, chocolate, toffee, and rich coffee nose. Thick and progressively astringent. All the aromas noted are detected in the flavor. Lactose as well. Scorched bitterness after the finish.
Couleur noire; mousse brune; arômes et goût de malt, de café et de chocolat noir; finale moyennement amère

Bottled - Opaque black colour, large, persistent creamy brown head, lacing. Intense roasted aromas, coffee, cocoa powder, dark chocolate, some fresh hoppiness. Taste is balanced bittersweet, caramel, toasted nuts, some chocolate and fruity hop bitterness. Medium to full body, average carbonation, bittersweet finish. Well balanced black ale, highly recommended.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2016 Bottle 0.33l from Hoppiness in Koper, Slo. Thick black liquid with small tan head. Full body, light carbonation. Roasted aroma, coffee. Strong roasted coffee and cocoa taste, medium sweetness, a hint of herbs.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pitch black color, average sized brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate, cocoa, vanilla, roasted malt. Taste is, again, lots of chocolate and cocoa, very, very, roasty, nice amount of hoppy fruitiness. Full bodied, smooth, complex and awesome.

Draught @ Fermentoren w friends/chef+US. Appearance: pours clear dark brown good soapy beige head and lacing. aroma/taste: caramel, nuts, chocolate and some coffee hints. palette strong roasted malty aroma, average carbonation, medium to full body, average sweetness, balanced by an average bitterness, medium duration and a watery texture. Overall: nice tasteful porter without to many burnt notes.

35.5cl bottle, served in Shaker. Pours black with small tan head. Aroma is chocolate, caramel, licorice and hints of coffee. Same taste with a touch of hops, it can easily pass as a Mocha beer, what means its so good. Very balanced and smooth with a dry finish, no alcohol presence, and even refreshing considering its a Porter. Medium / full body, good carbonation. Great brew.

Black color with medium brownish head. Nice aroma, mild, with dark chocolate, and light creamy touch. Smooth, round mouthfeel, good dark chocolate flavor, dryish, correct bitterness, some lactose, more roastiness in the final. Very good.

The truly artful thing about this beer is that its taste doesnt lose out on the subtleties of its nose, the dark caramel burn, with its coffee roast edges, smoothed out by bitter chocolate, bayleaf and other herbal fragrant hop aromas on a more chewy than oily palate. Nice and very long lasting roasted malt finish.

0,33l bottle at home courtesy of Saeglopur, big thanks. did not find the BB date. black color, small coffee-colored head. smells malty roasted, coffee, light vegetables, spices, earthy notes, some chocolate, light peat notes(?), some licorice. very nice smell, vegetable notes not too distracting. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of vegetables, some roast, coffee, spices, earthy notes, licorice, light peat again. finishes with some roast and vegetables and light bitterness. Overall OKish, vegetables are quite noticeable on the taste. smell is nice though. Overall drinkable but a bit weird.

Bottle as a birthday gift from Jill. Cheers! Pours black with a small beige head. The aroma is slightly nutty with coffee. The taste is bitter and lightly spicy at first with flavours of coffee and chocolate following. Theres a slight nuttiness running through it as well. Moderate carbonation gives it quite a full mouthfeel. Theres a long bitter finish with just enough alcohol to give a little warmth. Nice beer.

Zapach z butelki to intensywna czekolada ale też i całkiem sporo chmielu. Piwo nalewa się z piękną, drobną bujną, brązową i dosyć trwałą pianą. W barwie jest prawie czarne, całkowicie nieprzejrzyste. W aromacie ze szkła głównie czekoladowe, z lekkimi ciemnymi owocami i nutami wanilii oraz delikatnego ziołowego chmielu. W smaku wyraźna jest paloność i kawa, ale nie jest ona ostra ani długa, piwo jest dosyć słodkie z wyraźnymi ciemnymi owocami - głównie suszonymi czy nawet wędzonymi śliwkami. Pojawiają się nuty drzewne - aż trudno uwierzyć, że to piwo nie było leżakowane w beczce. Nisko wysycone, gęste, gładkie, pełne w odczuciu. Z intensywną, uderzającą głównie w posmaku paloną i tytoniową od chmielu goryczką. Alkohol leciutko grzeje w przełyk, ale jest to miłe uczucie.

Pours very nicely dark with low brown head
Aromas of hazelnuts, nougats, chocolate, hints of roasted malts, hints of coffee
Taste has brown bread, roasted malts, chocolate, nougats, caramel. Nice medium body with good coffee bitter ending

355 ml bottled 5.14.15, from Mikkeller Webshop.
Black body, with a quite small, fluffy, coffee colored head.
Aroma of chocolate, nuts, cocoa, coffee, earth, liquorice, dark and dried fruits.
Tastes of cocoa, coffee, liquorice, chocolate, tobacco, dark fruits, quite a lot of citric and piney hops.
Medium, oily mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes roasty-bitter, dry, with coffee, tobacco, liquorice, cocoa, piney hop notes, subtle alcohol.

Very tasty. Nice balance of strong roasty and moderate sweet notes, with a lot of hops from the background and a pleasantly dry finish. Drinks quite easy for the ABV however. Not my absolute favourite Porter, but an excellent style example nonetheless.

Porter sind schon eine besondere Sache. Diese hier bildet keine Ausnahme, auch wenn es durchaus akzeptabel war. Mit Kaffee, etwas Schoko, einigen Fruchtnoten, dazu eine nette Alkoholtiefe. Kann man trinken.

Bottle from Rudat in Dortmund. The beer has got a deep black colour with a small head and smooth body. Aroma of coffee, malt and plums. Taste of intense malt, roast, dark cherries, plums, prunes, torf and dark bread. Wonderful to drink.

355 mL bottle. Pours stout brown with a small, light brown head. Mild roast and chocolate milk in the nose. The roast is relatively mild in the flavour as well. Nice chocolate, though, and a hint of booze, which works, because of the solid body. And oatmealy smooth. Nice beer.
Pours black with a short lived dark brown head. Aroma is earthy, roasted malt, cocoa. Big flavours, lots of roasted malt, licorice, chicory.
Bottle from saveur-biere.com. Dark color, thin beige head. Medium body. Medium bitterness, low sweetness. Flavour is roasted, chocolate, nutty, light fruit.

다크호스 브루잉 - 리절브 스페셜 블랙에일 7.5% ABV 코코아, 커피, 비터 초컬릿 등의 쌉쌀한 맛에 치중한 블랙 에일.이것도 그렇고 원 오트밀스타우 그렇고 비교적 높은 도수임에도 마시기는 매우 편하다 

이 제품도 그렇고 어제 올린 것도 그렇고 이렇듯 허접한로고에 도수에 비해 밍밍한 느낌의 맥주들이 레이트 비어에서 98, 99점에 링크 되다니 조금 미스테리하기 하다. 


https://twitter.com/MaekJuBot

big body and dark malt and cocoa taste that seems a bit dry acrid and with licorice. the foundation is superb and you can do anything with it. intense and satisfying you can fall over yourself describing how they do stout and porter right from the get go.

Bottle a black colored beer with a white-off head aroma malts roasted malts coffee chocolate mocha dark fruits spices and hops flavor roasted malts coffee chocolate mocha caramel laurel dark fruits spices and hops

A pitch black beer with a thick dark tan coloured head. A strong roasted malt aroma, nutty and dark chocolate, plus hints of fruit and smoke. Dry mouthfeel. The taste is very bitter sweet. Roasted malt flavours, nutty and bitter dark chocolate, plus a smokiness. This is followed by a sweeter fruity flavour, red fruit and candied fruit that brings on a late zestiness. Bottle from Beers of Europe.
Dark in color with a good head.  The taste is dark malt, and chocolate notes.  There is a bitter after taste that comes with the beer.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2017 Pours black haze colour wiht big mousse-like firm head, which stays for a few minutes.
Visually low carbonation.
Aroma without note of an alcohol, with hints of molasses, oat, cocoa powder and dark chocolate.
Flavor: mild note of an alcohol, with hints of dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla.
Malt sweetness is medium, hop bitterness also, finish is slightly spicy with hints of fruits (esters of tropical fruits).
Body is soft, slightly sticky, carbonation is mild medium.

Color negro intenso opaco con media corona de espuma de buena retención; aromas a malta torrefacta, cacao, higos y ligero café; en boca entrada media con amargor equilibrado, notas a café torrefacto; cuerpo pleno con carbónico medio, largo pos gusto, maltoso, ligeramente amargo y licoroso; una compleja, equilibrada y bien balanceada cerveza, de estilo bien conseguido.
Beer tasting @ fillepolo 8/8-15. Bottle from Hoppiness, Koper. Roasted malty with chocolate and some coffee. Body is medium, the finish is dry and roasted with chocolate.
tasting @ fillepolo 150808. Bottle (330 ml) from l. Roasted malty with chocolate and coffee, sweet, medium body with a watery to oily texture. The finish is roasted with chocolate.
Bottle from hoppines in koper, slovenia. Roasted notes in both aroma and taste. Also some hoppy notes.

DWGIÅ; Drunk at Fermentoren. Bottle 12 FL. OZ. Pours small, black with a frothy, fading, still lacing tan head. Nose is moderate to heavy roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, dark dried fruit and liqorice. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter, balanced with a lasting roasted chocalate, warming finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat to soft.
Bottle. Dark brown, almost black with average foam. Taste and flavor are similar, with a predominance of black malt, chocolate and coffee, a little vanilla and dried fruits.

Bottle at home, 1st August 15. Black, slight head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, slight sweetness, liquorice. Taste is smooth, fairly complex, chocolate, liquorice, coffee. Palate light, not bad, but wouldnt rush for more

Bottle (from beergium.com). Pours dark brown with tan head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is smoke, roast, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, smoke, dark chocolate, malt, and vanilla. Finish is roast bitter. Overall: great brew.

Nose is strong roasted malts, nuts, and hopps. Smells like roasted malts and grain. Bouts black with a huge head. Bottle was way over carbonated. Had at home 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very dark brown beer, small tan head. Nose is roasty, some fruity hop notes, malt coffee. Flavor is roasty and hoppy, grapefruity notes, roast, coffee and chocolate. Finish is oranges, hoppy bitterness, chocolate, roast. Lovely blend of flavor s.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a very dark brown with a tan head. Roasted malt and coffe aromas. Roasted malt, chocolate, and coffee flavors. The mouthfeel is rich and creamy. Medium to full body. Overall very good beer.
Bottle at home. Espresso, dark chocolate, vanilla beans and dark fruit. A touch smokey. Pretty good.
Dark brown colur, low but nice, beige head. Coffee aroma, some chocolate, dried fruits and dark bread. Sweet taste, roasted malts, dark bread, coffee and some herbs.

355 ml bottle from Astral Beers. Pitch black, impossible to see through, with a small, creamy and peristent light brown head. Crazy nose, so powerful and in your face that you dont even need to keep the glass close: tons of roasted malts notes, 70%+ dark chocolate, vanilla beans, some subtle licorice presence as well. Taste follow suite with no surprises: slick and velvety mouthfeel that doesnt feel cloying at all, moderate but clean and lingering toasted and earthy bitterness, plenty of both chocolate and coffee taste. Excellent drinkability considering the ABV. Soft to average carbonation, medium body, oily texture. Superb!

Bottle. Black with a thin beige head. Aromas are coffee and dark chocolate with oily notes. Peppery with molasses and dark toffee and light meatiness. Cola with earthy soy. Flavours are sweet molasses with earthy peat and pepper. Coffee with dark chocolate. Good.

Bottle. Black colour with almost no head with brown colour. Aroma roasted, cocoa, nutty, caramel. Taste very roasted, maybe too much, espresso, cocoa, caramel, some earthy hop tones. A bit earthy and a bit harsh roasted aftertaste. Full body. But overall very good.

Czarne, nieprzejrzyste. Piana opada dosc szybko, ale jest, bezowa i drobna. Ladnie zdobi szklo. Aromat gesty, czekoladowy, wrecz risowy. Dosc szybko sie jednak rozwiewa. W smaku palone, co ciekawe z nutami gumy balonowej, moze lesnych owocow. Palony, dlugi aftertaste.

Roasted aromas, quite a bit of chocolate, a bit sweet - just nicely so.

Color is black, with a fairly small tan head.

Taste is a bit sweet with a nice general bitterness.

Full bodied; oily/creamy texture; a long finish, with roasted coffee and chocolate.

Overall this is a quite good beer. Good complexity, with roasted coffee, chocolate and some sweetness that works well, providing some balance.

Prezentacja:
czarne, nieprzejrzyste, piana brązowa, obfita, bardzo drobna, utrzymuje się, nieźle zdobi szkło pianą i płaczem
;
Aromat: 
kawa, czekolada, leciutki alkohol, po zabełtaniu czuć kwiaty i owoce
;
Odczucie:
dosyć treściwe, bardzo gładkie, średnio nasycone, bąbelki lekko gryzą w przełyk, finisz bardzo czekoladowy
;
Smak: 
wyraźny, słony, kwaskowy, kawowy i czekoladowy
;
Ogólnie:
świetne
.
Draft at the craft beer festival , beer at the pier in the south street seaport. Deep black color with a nice porter like flavor. Very easy drinki ng and nice flavor. Very good
Dark brown to black body with a medium brown head. Aroma is coffee, dark chocolate, dark very roasted malt. Taste is medium sweet with medium to heavy bitter. Medium body, dry bitter smokey finish.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2016 Pours darkest brown. Rocky moka head.
Aroma is intense: coffee, lemon peel, ruccula, beef jerky, caramel, black olives, even squid ink!
Dense, fresh and quite long, with an aftertaste that reminds of coffee beans.

Bottle. Pitch black with big, light brown, densed head. Average head retention, good lacing. Strong roasted malts, dark chocolate and coffee aromas. Taste is medium bitter, mainly dark chocolate in the aroma, also roasted dark coffee and some earthy and caramel notes. Medium to full body, thick texture soft carbonation Long, roasty, semi bitter finish. In general good raw porter with strong bitter notes. Enjoy.
An almost black beer with a coffe aroma. Its too roasty for me and uneasy to drink. The end is too long as well. Not for everybody

Dark brown color with beige head, good lacing. Smell is dark coffee, dark chocolate. A bit chalky. Taste is the same, really really dry with hints of coffee, chalk and chocolate. I like dry, but this is too dry for a porter. Feels like powder in your mouth. Not easy to drink.

354 mml bottle tasted on the 14/04/2015. Almost pours black colour with a decent beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, coffee and black chocolate. Taste is is light sweet, malty, coffee and some licorice. Light alcohol on the tongue. Next one please!
Nice aroma of bittersweet malts and sweet chocolate. Very smooth, rich and oily. Fairly intense bitterness but well balanced by the sweetness of the chocolate.

Appearance is very dark, almost black, a half finger beige frothy head. Aroma- smoky, leather, dark chocolate, fudge, creamy malt, molasses, chocolate cake, sultanas, vanilla. Taste- bitter chocolate, cocoa powder, roast malt, burnt toast, treacle, dark chocolate Hob Nobs. Quite a long, bitter finish, not that full in the mouth. Good stuff.
From bottle. Almost black, inky with tan foam ring. Dark chocolate flavor with coffee notes. Medium bodied, nice cacao finish.
very roasty aroma, appear black with a small brown head. taste medium bitter. average carbonation, full bodied, long bitter aftertaste

Dark brown, almost black with medium creamy light brown head. Roasted malt and coffee aroma. Rich roasted malt bitterness with good coffee and chocolate notes followed by some vanilla sweetness. Some remaining bitter and chocolate aftertaste.
UPDATED: AUG 28, 2015 Pours dark brown to black with a tan head. Aromas of chocolate and coffee. Medium on the palette. Flavors the same as aroma along with some smokiness. Very nice beer.

ブラックエー  
ホッピーな香&

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2015 Wow! This is a VERY good brew. Ive heard this called a black IPA...its not. Its more like a porter with a little more hop bitterness...but barely. Nose is roast malt, dark chocolate and coffee. Very full body with a chewy mouth-feel. Bittersweet hop and dark coffee aftertaste. Very unique....very tasty!

Draught @ Fermentoren, Århus. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, licorice, expresso, dried dark fruit. Flavor is light sweet, malty, coffee, cookies, licorice, dried fruit, light alcohol. Medium body, soft carbonation, light warming alcohol in the finish. Very nice, in a good way feels a little stronger than the 7,5% ABV. 260215

Black colour, brownish head. Aroma of milk chocolate, cookies, cinemmon, molasses, cream. Taste is light bitter a bit sweet. Medium body, slick texture, soft to average carbonation. Dry. Quite interesting.

Bottle. Pours deep black, tan head. Good retention/some lace. Aroma of roast, dark chocolate, iced coffee, light fudge. Taste is moderately bitter, roast, dark chocolate, light sweetness. Palate is drier, slick, bitter/roasty finish.

Bottle into fancy stout glass. Ok tan head. Black beer. Great aroma of roasted malt, bitter chocolate, leather and some coffee. Taste is dry and quite bitter - almost aggressive. If they tones this down a notch and smoothed it out would be fantastic. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured into a teku glass showing dark black center with very thin coffee brown rims and coffee colored sparse foam. 

The nose shows a lot of cacao and dark chocolate with some hints of coffee bean. 

The palate is medium-full bodied with a lot of roasted malt and coffee bean flavors. A slight black coffee tartness in the middle with a good black coffee bitterness at the finish. The finish is long and roasty. Achieves exactly what the brewer set out to do.
Keg at the Mikkeller bar. Pours black, nose is chocolate, coffee, dark fruit, taste is similar.
Great porter with chocolate and coffee notes. Very robust like a stout, but slightly lighter in body. On the sweet side with not a lot of hops character.

Served in teku, small bottle. Pours totally black with beige, medium head. Head retention looks pretty good. Aroma is mostly caramel, some maltiness along with piney hint. All of that goes well with distinct dark chocolate smell. Taste is quite complex, much chocolate, some caramel and toast, although chocolate is most dominant, however, its rather kind of chocolate cookie or biscuit. There is mild bitterness in finish, mostly grass or herbs, mixed well with all that chocolate stuff. Finish is deep and long. Softly carbonated. Great beer, overall impression is that its kind of raw and earthy porter. Very good and enjoyable.

Pour on tap at the brewery, dark reddish black pour with off white head, aroma brought notes of dark fruit, cocoa, roast, some nice earthy tones into more sweet lactose and chocolate notes, some slight yeast. Taste is sweet cocoa, roast, dark coffee, some earthy tones into a bit of caramel, toffee, finishing sweet, roasty. Good stuff.

330ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Black color with beige brown creamy frothy head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, milk chocolate, coffee. Sweet and bitter taste like the aroma with the addition of dark fruits. Medium to full body, oily, soft carbonation.

330 ml bottle, pours black with a tan head, lovely thick body on this withlots of roasty, chocolate malt, with a bit of smoke and some piney hop. Finish is short and dry, bitter. Love the full body on this very rich in the mouth with creamy texture and soft carbonation. Lovely stuff.

[6388-20140627] Cask. Roasted chocolate malt aroma. Black body with medium-lasting bubbly brown head. Roasted barrel wood malt flavour. Full body. Very tasty. (7/3/8-/4/16) 3.8
(Glasgow Real Ale Festival 2014 @ The Briggait, Glasgow, Scotland)

355ml bottle from Beers of Europe. Pours jet black, no head. Whisper of carbonation. Big tar and liquorice aromas, burnt fruit. Taste is rich, sweet, oily. Needs a little zest to lift it, bit cloying. Nice enough.

Black colour with a medium light cream tan head with good lacings. Aromas of dark bitter chocolate dominate on the nose but also toasted malt notes and coffee aromas develop with a very restrained light fruit-hoppyness (retronasal). Softly carbonated with a light slick-creamy texture this beer is offering a light sweetness with a harmonic roasted chocolate malt bitterness in a medium body. The finish is chocolatey and well lasting. Good porter!

BOTTLE 12 OZ.
Bold chocolate aroma, some vanilla and cocoa flavoured desert. The flavour is more roasted with strong hop bitterness. Excellent.

Bottle. Pours a clear dark amber/brown with small tan head. Aroma is dark malts, dark chocolate, roasty and some raisins. Taste is dark chocolate, that fades out in a really dry coffee roastiness and too some bitter from the hops. Relatively light body. All the way through its loaded with liquorice. Chocolate stays in the mouth for a long time.

330ml bottle served in an English pint. 
A: Pours a deep black color forming a big and very bubbled brown head. Medium to low retention forming some lingering thin lacings in the glass. 
S: Strong notes of roasted malts, dark chocolate and coffee. Strong notes of wood and earth. Sweet and biscuity nose. Reminds an Oreo biscuit. Grassy hops. 
T: Slightly sweet upfront. Again, strong notes of roasted malts, dark chocolate and coffee. In overall, a dry and bitter taste. Notes of leather, wood and earth. Bitter end. Grassy hops profile. Great! 
M:Medium body. Low carbonation. Bitter roasted aftertaste. 
O: Great drinkability. J.U.S.T excellent Porter!
Bottled. It is a good porter. I dig it. Nice brown medium head, roasted beans, chocolate, nuts, long aftertaste.

Bottle from Drankenhalle Deconinck, Vichte. Dark brown/black colour, brown foam. Medium carbonation. Very well balanced. Roasted malts, coffee, ashes with light sweet hints. Easy drinkable. Very good!
Pours the color of ink with a thin tan head. Aroma is sweet with a hint of alcohol. Taste is hoppy like a black IPA. Finally a decent beer from Dark Horse.

Bottle of 33cl.

Nice stout, but one of the worst Ive tasted. Got a nice dark colour (so a nice appearance), nice palate but got a faste, slightly taste of chocolate and coffee.

Try it if its free, but dont pay for it.

Bottle from Embrouille, thanks! Roasted, tart pumpernikel bread coupled with softer notes of dark chocolate and coffee. A light whiff of hops and some heated (not burned) wood, like in a sauna. Full bodied, starting off malty and getting more coffeeish and woody in the finish. I feel the roast is a bit over the top though, giving the beer more tartness than it needs and accounting for the rather rough mouthfeel. I prefer my big beers more mellow.

Julie thinks that it is okay and it taste how Sophia smells I think it is pretty good taste more like coffee though than chocolate

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at Fermentoren. Pours black with close to no head. Aromas of strong coffee, some licorice, bitter chocolate. Taste is strong roast, coffee beans, bitter dark chocolate, sweet dark fruits.
Pours opaque black with a coffee head. Aroma strong in coffee, light black licorice. Strong roasted coffee bean taste with dark chocolate. Dark chocolate aftertaste.
Poured pitch black with a frothy beige head. Aroma of roast malt, dark chocolate and dark fruit. Medium body, flavour is chocolatey sweet, lightly bitter.

Bottle from Erzbierschof - Black color with medium brown head, good lasting and lacing - Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt, ciffee, soy sauce, sweet malt, vanilla, earthy hops - Flavor of roasted malt, licorice, soy sauce and coffee - Medium body, medium/high bitterness, good carbonation, dry & bitter, dry bitter roasted finish - a mix between a porter and a black ipa, strong bitterness well hiden at first nose, good but very special
Bottle. Black color with a medium thin foamy brown head. Aroma of citrus, nuts, roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Medium dry taste with some bitterness.

On tap at OConnors. Black with mocca head. Aroma is roasted, dark chocolate and some burnt sugar notes. Taste is similar, lots of roasted notes, malty sweetness, chocolate, light coffee with a finishing bitterness.

Black pour with an espresso head fades quick. Aroma of sugar and coffee, a little caramel. Medium mouth, a little syrupy. Taste is full of chocolate and roasted coffee. A hint of nuttiness. A little lace present. Very flavorful.

On tap at Petes Place. A nice dark pour with a dark chocolate colored head. A light chocolate aroma. Flavor has a nice milk chocolate taste that is quite smooth. A nice carbonation mixes in. Overall a smooth chocolate malty finish brew. Good stuff.

August 21, 2014. On tap at Rover.
Pours black with a creamy tan head. Aroma is milk chocolate, dark bitter chocolate, vanilla, light smoke, ash. Taste is medium roasted bitterness with chocolate and coffe, light to medium sweet malty. Finish is light sweet, medium roasted bitterness with some ash notes in the back. Medium bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation.

pours unclear dark brownn with a small reviving light beige head leaving little lacing. torrefied wheat, roasted malts - some smoky notes, tobacco, strong bitter coffee, very dusty, awkward fruitiness - melons, resin. light carbonation, light body, assertive if not slightly harsh resinous-coffee finish. above average porter.

Pours near black, finger thick, creamy khaki head, nice lacing. Aroma black malt, earthy, bit of smoke, slight burnt sugar. Taste scorched malt, burnt sugar, smokey, earthy, almost charcoal, a bit of caramel and bitter sweet chocolate to balance it out. Mouthfeel fuller body, lower carbonation, slight roast astringency, dry finish. Overall great beer, very complex roasted malt flavors, enough caramel and chocolate flavors to balance, perfect amount of hops to add to flavor without being overpowering, possibly the most balanced "dark, beer Ive ever had, while maintaining complexity.

Growler from Railroad poured into an Imperial pint glass. Pours black with big brown head. Aroma is mild fruity aldehydes, bittersweet chocolate, smoke, and slight nutty notes. First sip is similar with huge roasted flavors, I malted barley and great mouth feel. Finish is lingering black malt bitterness.nice porter

Bottle pour. Many similarities with their Thirsty Trout porter. Dark full body with a thin tan head. Intense cocoa and slightly smoked malts. Smooth mouthfeel with a good amount of bitterness. Lots to like here.

Had on tap in Ann Arbor at a place with 4 beers on tap one of which was bud light. Thats what happens when you are 45 minutes from the brewer. Pours very dark, with brown head. Aroma is roasty malt with cocoa. Medium big mouthfeel. Flavor is malt sweetness up front, then roasted malt and cocoa. Good beer. Totally stumbled onto this one, life is good :)

Bottle shared by czar, thanks bro! Pours a nice black again (just like its Fore Smoked Stout sibling) with a small beige rim that leaves good lacing. Nose is of roasted malt, light smoke and some alcohol. Taste is of coffee, intense roast, some ash, nuts and moderately bitter. Body was medium, carbonation as well and mouthfeel was sticky. Overall a good porter that might have suffered from the comparison with the smoked stout we had just before it.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, coffee, 
Appearance-black, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-perfect
Bottle pour. Jet black with small brown head. Molasses, coffee, chocolate, roasted malt and light wood. All balanced well. Taste is semi bitter, dark chocolate, barley and more coffee. Good stuff.

Pours a pitch black with a thin tan head. Roasty, caramelized sugar aroma. Rich, bitter black malt base dominates this brew. Sticky, sugary sips emanate from this medium bodied, but full flavored black ale.

Dark black pour, khaki head. Aroma is rich. Roasted malts, chocolate and coffee. Taste is amazing. Smooth. Chocolate, coffee, roasted malts. Bitter aftertaste. Very eady to drink. only downfall is its a bit thin. Overall very good enjoyable beer.

12fl oz bottle. Pours black with a thin, beige head. Aroma has big notes of dark chocolate, coffee, and roasted malts. A hint of hops to balance it out. Taste is a big bitter. Coffee and dark chocolate with an espresso bitter aftertaste. Medium-full body with a low-medium carbonation. Slightly creamy in the mouth with a semi dry finish. Overall a big, bitter, roasty brew. Lots of coffee and dark malts.
Black colored poor. Big tan head. Plenty of lacing. Nice hoppy aroma with hints of chocolate and malt. Taste is some chocolate and citrus.

A kissé bohókás küllemű üvegben lapuló főzet igen összeszedett és kiforrott jellemvonásokkal bír, egy vérbeli portertől elvárt karakterisztikával, melynek minden mozzanata a kulináris kielégülés szolgálatába van állítva. Egyenfekete színe frissen őrölt kávé és kakaótartalommal gazdagon ellátott étcsokoládé aromáját rejti, mely a pörkölt illatok legfinomabb változataival kedveskedik nekünk. Selymes ízének magától értetődő jellegzetessége szintén e grillesre pirított maláta és karakteres kávé kettőse egy tűhegyes éllel beköszönve és némi földes jelleggel megspékelve - csak a miheztartás végett. A keményvonalas hatást nagymértékben elősegíti a komlókesernyés utóíz, mely által sörünk meglehetősen száraz finissel búcsúzik. Nagyjából azt nyújtja, amit egy tengerentúli porter kortyolgatásától remél az ember: karakteres, markáns ízeket, meghitt perceket a harmónia nyugtató tapasztalása közben.

Like pouring oil out of a bottle. 1 finger tan head with good retention. Aromas of roasted malt, slight cocoa and caramel. Very thin on the tongue and like a dark roast coffee w/ cocoa. Hard to believe this is 7.5%. I really liked it.

Bottle: Jet black in the glass, full opacity with a slow, inverse cascading cappuccino head, a little frothy & creamy. Aroma has creamy smooth notes of coffee, light sweetness edging towards a lactose/milk aspect, bakers chocolate, just a hint of of sweet, dark dried fruits. A little roast, but the nose seems more sweet. Taste is a little more roasty; roasted malts & dry coffee beans up front leading into notes of bittersweet, dark cocoa nibs, & faint anise. Dry coffee bean finish with a kiss of light smoke. Kind of thin, would do well with a more creamy body. Not bad.
Totally black and oily in expression. Delicious rich warm beer with lots of flavor of hard roasted chocolate malt.

Super porter. Dosadny tresciwy. Na poczatku solidna dawka slodowosci kawy i czekolady a takze budyniu i trufli. Potem po przelknieciu zdecydowana palonosc slodu, suszone owoce i torf. Chwile potem w gardle mocna gorycz i pikantna koncowka. Dlugo utrzymujaca sie goryczka i palonosc w oddali jeszcze sie wyczuwa. Kawa plus czekolada. Tresciwe i sycace, a alkoholu sie nie wyczuwa. Porzadny czarny nieprzezroczysty porter ze spora i zadowalajaca brazowa piana.

12oz bottle. Just started getting dark horse distro here. Pours a pretty solid black with a minimal tan head. Aromas of toffee, roasted nuts. No perceptible hop aroma. Taste is semi sweet and lightly bitter. Flavors are a haphazard mish mash of week old coffee, wet cardboard, pronounced sweetened dumpster drippings and cocklash. No.
On tap. Pour is very dark brown with a thin tan head. Aroma and flavor of roasted malt, licorice, coffee creamer, and cocoa. Good, a bit thin for the ABV.

Bona cervesa, es bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, es bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.

Very black bodied and small dark head. Dark malts, little coffee, little vanilla, aged, smooth and well integrated rather than a mix of separate aroma. Most apparent in the nice hop mix that provides a solid bitter punch in the the taste. Excellent mouth feel too. Aroma is nice, but the palate and richness of the taste are even better. Great brew! (Bottle from Saveur Bière)
Dark pour with a tan head. Dark chocolate and coffee. Flavour is roasted malts and coffee. Nice lingering aftertaste.
Excellente bière noire très équilibrée, arômes de chocolat/café avec une post amertume très longue... Une bière gourmande !
Black pour from draft at kaiser tiger. Sticky tan head. Malty chocolate and cocoa taste. Wheaty. Pretty good. Bitter finish on this guy
Flaska. Svart öl md medelstort moccafärgat skum. Choklad och kaffe samt rostad malt i doften. Smakinslag av desamma samt säd. Beskan ramlar in i eftersmaken. Lätt kolsyra.
Shared a bottle with Bruce. Pours almost black with a thin tan head. Aroma is chocolate roast and some coffee. Flavor is dark chocolate and dark maltiness. Really nice beer.
Botella de 35,5 cl, adquirida en www.biirkonnen.com. Color negro. Sabor a malta tostada, chocolate, regaliz.

Dark brown pour with a nice tan head. Aroma is hoppy, roasted, and a little chocolatey. Taste is bitter hops and deep, dark malt. Bready mouthfeel, full body, soft carbonation give this beer a very satisfying palate. I like this beer a lot. Very straight forward but what it lacks in complexity, it makes up for in taste, making it very sessionable. Awesome for barbecues.

Looks beautiful and appetizing with its black colour and dark tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate, coffee. Flavour is roasty, coffee, espresso, some liquorice, burned sugar. Some bitterness in the aftertaste.
Pours black with compact tan head. Aroma is dark choc and licorice. Taste adds a little coffe-bitterness and some sweetness later on. Creamy mouthfeel, low carb. Nice.

Bottle. Pours cloudy very dark brown with airy but stable dark tan head. Dark aroma of malt, caramel and dried fruit. Roasty flavour of malt and coffee, with notes of dark chocolate and touches of fruit. Warming alcohol presence. Lingering, roasty afteraste. Good. Really good.

Bottle. The aroma starts off fruity, turns vinous and OK dusty. Black colour. Small stable dark brown head. The flavour is roasted, chalky, dusty (perhaps even vanilla?), with a good coffee note and a little alcohol in the finish. Hint of salt in the finish. Surprisingly good considering the label :)

355 ml bottle. Black color with a nice thick brown head. Aromas of bitter chocolate and coffee initially with some burnt and roasted notes following. Taste was dark chocolate, coffee, some burnt sugar and earthy hops. Maybe some dark fruits too. Aftertaste was bitter and sticky. Light to medium body with low carbonation.

Bouteille 33cl servie dans un verre Teku. Bière intensément noire, absence de mousse. Bière assez plate, plutôt lisse, nez sur le café fort et les baies. Beaucoup de corps, le palais est sur les grains, le réglisse et le café, finale assez sèche sur le chocolat noir et le houblon amer. Bière très plaisante.
Botella. Porter equilibrada, aroma a cafè i xocolata. Gust torrat al principi obrint-se i deixant una amargor floral a la gola. Òptima

Pours very dark brown. Medium to large frothy brown head, lasting with good lace. Aroma is rich, dark chocolate, licorice, coffee. Dark, burnt, and roasty. Flavor is less chocolatey than nose, instead, much more hard roasted, burnt, ash. Soft Medium body. Very Firm bitterness in the finish, probably too much for my liking, sort of ashy piney.
Aroma-roasty, black licorice, cocoa. Taste is similar to aroma, very bitter finish.

Bottle at Euston Tap, London on 28 February 2014. Poured black with a thick, dense tan head and great lacing. Aroma of burnt sugar, coffee and dark malts. Initial flavour had a mild acidity to it, which was off-putting for a second or two, but then dissipated, to be replaced by treacle, roasted malt and tobacco. Mouth feel was nice and thick, with some noticeable carbonation. Finish was mildy smokey, with roasted malt, espresso and dark fruit sweetness.

12oz bottle poured into a goblet. Dark, and for the fun of it I shined a 310 lumen flashlight through it and no light was seen through the beer. That might not mean anything but it was neat. Strong sweet(?) aroma that I find pleasant. Not much of a head and what there is , is not there for long, Taste is a bitter dark chocolate flavor and for me thats all I get. I dont think this is really a porter and if it is its kind of disappointing so Ill stick to calling it a black/dark ale, If it was thicker I might considerate a stout. but its not. Overall its not to bad but if I want to drink something that has the appearance of anti-matter. I might choose something else.

Poured from a bottle with a dark brown color with a foamy tan head. Has a coffee and chocolate aroma, and taste is also coffee and chocolate, though with a bitter finish. Has a nice medium body feel. This has a stout feel and flavor, but without the roasted malts. Probably one of my favorite porters.

Bottle as Reserve Special Black Bier Ale, a cream colour unlike the picture on RB, complete with cartoon horse, no date or details of ABV. Pours black with a very small, disappearing head. Aroma - initially molasses, slightly sour, coffee and liquer. Settles on chocolate and nutella. Good - inviting. Body is medium, smooth, not foamy, carbonation is low. Taste - rounded malts, a touch of molasses sweetness, finishes tangy and dry. Smooth, light flavour. One word sums up the beer - smooth. Very, very good porter.
UPDATED: NOV 26, 2014 One of the best porters I tasted. Rich taste of coffee and chocolate, with a nice mouthfeel due to the heavy roasting.

Barwa: czarna, nieprzejżysta. Piana beżowa, średnio obfita, szybko opadajaca.

Aromat: melanoidyny plus czekolada, minimalnie alkoholowy, ale dosyć skromny.

Smak: lekko słodki, malanoidyny, palone słody skutkująco dodatkową, pozostającą goryczką.

Przynam, że mogło być lepiej. Nie do końca wiem ską biorą się atk wysokie oceny tego piwa. Nie mam smaku lub piłem już tak dużo ciekawych piw, że trudno mi dogodzić. Akcenty melanoidynowe dominuja i zabijają zacznie ciekwasze palone czy czekoladowe. Nadal nr 1 z tego browaru pozostaje zatem Perkulator.

Bottle cotteridge wines Birmingham. Black colour mocha head. Aroma is liquorice coffee roasted malts. Taste is same some sweet chocolate slight smokiness nice lingering bitter finish. Good full body soft carbonated. V nice porter.

Nose is licorice, coffee, a touch of leather. Taste is coffee, leading to licorice then chocolate, with a bitter slightly piney hoppy finish.

A nice American Porter.

het bier schenkt in als zwart met minimale bruine kraag, maar direct komt er al een héérlijk aroma je neus ingevlogen van chocolade, koffie, mouten (geroosterde- en gebrande), simpelweg héérlijk !
De smaken erna beginnen matige/redelijke zoet, gaan over in een redelijke bitterheid van koffie/espresso, en dan komen de complexe tonen van chocolade, de diverse mouten (gebrand en geroosterd), en wat caramel, krijg tevens het idee dat er een lichte pepertoets in zit. 
volle body, romig in de mond, lage co2, en een kruidig zoete en bittere afdronk.,
enig minpuntje is wel dat de bitterheid in de afdronk wat minder had gekund !
Simply amazing porter! Dark brown head. Roasted cocoa chocolate aroma. Full bodied, dark chocolate bitter, so well balanceed taste. I think its the best porter Ive ever had.
Dunkelbraunes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, Karamell, Schokolade, Vanille. Geschmack röstmalzig süß, Schokolade, würzig.
Poured a dark mahogany with a thin off white head. The aroma is roasted malt. The flavour is medium bitter with a malt liqourice slight creamy coffee palate with a short bitter finish.

Bottle. Pitch black with dark brown, small head. 
Rich cacao aroma with chocolate, and roasted malt. 
Black chocolate, cacao, coffee, roasted malts, hops and dark fruits on taste. 
Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied and medium carbonation. 
Hoppy finish with cold coffee, cacao and milk chocolate. 
Easy smooth porter.

Bottle at Llama Tooth.
Appearance: Pitch black body with a dense brown head.
Aroma: Cocoa with and earthy hoppiness and light roasted malts. Good aroma strength.
Taste: Cocoa and roasted malts with a mild piney and earthy bitterness. All three flavors are balanced nicely with some coconut on the back end. Coffee lingers.
Palate: Medium bodied, moderately carbonated.
Overall: Good hoppy porter, really brings the elements of the two styles together.

Reserve (indeed, it is not on the front lines like BLATZ), Black (true it is dark like a womans soul) Ale (not a lager). So truth in advertising, or WHAT? Could see pounding a few of these on the holidays and telling a few "truths" at the family dinner: like why is Uncle Mike such a lick knob?, or asking "Why is Blatz SO superior to EVERY OTHER BEVERAGE OF ALL TIME!?" Its true, I am silly like that. So grab some Blatz for your old alcoholic self and let these sit in the icebox waiting your so-called "sophisticated" friends. Than you can relax in the knowledge of your own immense superiority and prepare to unleash your Blatz soaked WISDOM unto the unsuspecting rabble that you call your "friends"! Viva lBlatz!

Draft and bottle - pours dark brown almost black . Bitter coffee and chocolate aromas . Mild hop bite , alittle chewy . Very good . 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours very thick, with very little carbonation, little brown head, black liquid. Aroma is intensely malty, with caramel, chocolate, vanilla, coffee and clove. Full body, creamy thick mouthfeel, low carbonation, long bitter finish. Taste is initially sweet and turns into intensely bitter, with roasted coffee notes. Very complex and amazingly balanced.

Very good porter, dressed in an imperial stout, with a marked character to roasted malts defined by the coffee and chocolate notes, both in nose and mouth. The best is their looking -that deep brown head!!- and the full body, strong but not aggressive. Great, nice porter, but I still prefer other ones, like Tsarina Esra.

12 oz. bottle, sent from robloc303 (thanks a lot, Rob), pours a jet oily black with a small beige head. Aroma brings out toasted malt, earthy hops, and fruity sweet caramel - doesnt strike me as a porter, but some fruity sweet black strong ale. Flavour is somewhere in between - certainly not a typical porter - brining out notes of dry cocoa, fruity notes, and caramel. Decent hopping as well. Quite robust and full-bodied. A bit too fruity and syrupy for my taste, but still enjoyable. Decent stuff, but way overrated.

Bottle at Pibar, LausanneBlack color with medium brownish head. Nice aroma, mild, with dark chocolate, and light creamy touch. Smooth, round mouthfeel, good dark chocolate flavor, dryish, correct bitterness, some lactose, more roastiness in the final. Very good.
12oz bottle to pint. Black pour. Dark and roasty. Very stout like in appearance and taste.

Bottled. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and licorice. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and bitter. Medium to full bodied, creamy text. And flat carb. A great porter.
Bottle. Pours black with a brown head. Dark chocolate and roasted coffee in the taste and aroma. Nice.

Poured from 12 oz. bottle after cellaring for 8 months. 

Opaque, black-brown with a dark tan head and very good lacing. 

Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruit (mainly raisins and cherries) and earthy hops. 

Taste of chocolate, roasted malt, licorice, cherries, earthy hops and citrus. 

Medium/full body and medium/high carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a bottle it is a dark brown with a tan head. The atoms is mocha. The taste is mocha and resonated bitter sweet on the palate
From a 12 oz bottle shared at home. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of chocolate and licorice. Flavors of roasted nuts. Medium bodied, smooth mouthfeel, bitter roast finish.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2013 Bottle @ home. Very dark brown, small tan head, good lacing. Aroma, roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, dark fruits. Taste, roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, dry licorice. Dry liquorice aftertaste. Dry mouth feel.

Bottle - thanks, J! Pours nearly black, minimal head. Roast, chocolate and coffee aroma with a little cardboard thrown in. Taste: moderate sweetness, light roast bitter finish. Medium body, soft carbonation, texture is slick but a little thin. Overall: Im surprised they call this a porter, but to each his own, especially when it comes to arbitrary classification boundaries.

So after almost two years since I have tasted it on tap at Csakajósör, finally ran into a bottle of this beer at the same bar too. Pours black with a near red foam, this beer mesmerises me with heavy roasted chocolate, almond and surprisingly a hint of coconut aromas. Body is heavy as well, kinda espresso-like; it lefts you with a very dry dance of flavours derived from the roasted malts and hops. A true classic obviously, and according to the head of Csakajósör, new kegs are going to arrive soon.
Pitch black colour with a small brown head. Great, chocolate, licorice and caramel aroma. Full, decentlly carbonated body. Dry roasted malty flavour with dark chocolate, espresso. Delicious.

12 oz. bottle from Total Wine, Virginia Beach, VA. Pours very dark brown, almost black, with a short tan head. Aroma of rich roasted espresso, smoke, and licorice. The flavor features expected dark chocolate and espresso flavors upfront but nearly shares the stage with the anise and light floral hops that are on the finish. Medium bodied. This is a world class porter.
12oz bottle - pours black with brown head. Nose is nutty chocolate with coffee nearby. Sip intensifies the roast.

Pours black from the bottle with a small tan head. Aroma of chocolate. Flavor of roasted chocolate and roasted malts and a bit of licorice, and bitter like baking chocolate. Medium mouthfeel. Bitter finish.

Massive dark beer with a thick brown whipped-cream-head. The aroma has lots of chocolate, but at a closer "look" you find licorice, a heavy roast, burned sugar and a slight smoke too. The taste is very chocolaty at first, but fades to more coffee and burned notes. Very powerful and delicious after the first couple of seconds. For some reason i expected a rather hoppy, light porter, but i was wrong!

The Sampler, Brooklyn tap: Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is dark chocolate, and lots of it, with some dark roast coffee, and some roasted malts. Taste is slightly bitter, but in a bitter chocolate way rather than a bitter hop way. Load of roasted flavors. Extremely smooth mouthfeel. Very complex and substantial, yet ridiculously easy to drink. Quite nice.

Extra in a trade... Awesome! Pitch black pour with a small mocha head that reduces to a film. Coffee, roast, and licorice on the nose. Taste is bitter coffee, unsweetened chocolate, slight hoppy bite. Lasting taste after the sip has been consumed. This is a great porter.
Very dark brown. Very roasty. Bit of chocolate. Like a light imperial stout.

0.330ml bottle  session with Thirsty Trout Porter  Pours opaque black, tan beige rocky-thick top. Aroma - malty, woody and something interesting what I cant describe. Flavor more roasty, dark chocolate. Taste is not too sweet, mild bitter, balanced around without sharpness. Chocolate note is mayor, a bit sour at the end, mild dry finish, flavor seems more lively than other companion. Medium to full body, thick texture, light carbonation. Malt astringency on tongue in aftertaste along with bitter, herbal roast notes.
On tap at dark horse. Pours straight black with a tan head. Hoppy grassy aroma. Medium thick mouth feel. Medium carbonation.

Bottle. Black with a small head. Creamy with some maltiness. Pleasant.
but nothing outsatanding. Still worth trying though.

Bottle. Poured a beautiful opaque black with a tan khaki top and some lacing. Taste of dark chocolate, roasted and toasted malts, smoke, nutty, and a slight bitter finish. Medium-thick body, medium carbonation. Cheers!

Bottle from Matt. Thanks!

A: Pours solid black with a very thin dark mocha head that disappears in an instant. 

N: Heavy malt, coffee, some caramel and bark. Very nutty with a lashing of milk chocolate. Blackstrap molasses.

T: Loads of bittersweet chocolate and coffee. Displays depth of both bitterness and sweetness. Can really melt into this.

M: Luxurious and creamy. Alcohol is well-hidden. Med. body.

O: Fantastic rendition of the style. Absolutely packed with flavor. Id take this over even the latest renditions of Deschutes BB Anniversary series.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Jet black, no head despite decent carbonation. This Englishman would humbly suggest that this is a rather stout version of a porter. Huge roasted barley flavour, some coffee, bit of chocolate, some ash. Heavy, tasty, bitter. Its nice.
Draft at Hopleaf, Chicago. Pours near black with a beige head. Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate, big roast. Flavour is moderate sweet and heavy bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Grifo. Copa de Cata en el BierCab (Barcelona). Color negro y espuma marrón. Corona persistente que deja un amplio collar en las paredes. Aromas intensos de chocolate y regaliz, notas de maltas tostadas y dulces y leve torrefacto en nariz. Entrada cremosa que cede a un contundente amargor por las maltas torrefactas. Cuerpo medio y carbonatación moderada. Paladar aterciopelado y textura densa. En el intermedio afloran sabores de ciruelas pasas y chocolate fundido. Final dulce con leve amargor y retrogusto prolongado. Deliciosa !!
On-tap. Tasting glass @ BierCab (Barcelona). Black color, brown froth. Lasting crown leaves a wide lacing collar on sides. Intense chocolate & licorice aromas, toasted & sweet malt notes, slight roasted to the nose. Creamy upfront & sharp bitterness from roasted malts. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Velvet palate & dense texture. Prunes & fudge chocolate in the middle. Sweet & slight bitter finish. Long aftertaste. Delicious !!

Tap at the Hopleaf, Chicago. Poured a dark mahogany with a thin off white head. The aroma is roasted malt. The flavour is medium bitter with a malt liqourice slight creamy coffee palate with a short bitter finish.
Dark horse is an awesome brewery. This beer has a nice mix of chocolate and coffee. Taste is light coffee, hints of chocolate and a nice malty mild- bitter finish.
Excellent beer. Not sure why it is not classified as a porter. Perfect coffee, malt character.
bottle. Black with small head. Seems more like a stout than anything else. Chocolate and coffee. I expected more of a Schwarzbier, but this is decent.

Pours dark dark brown with lasting lacing tan head. Aroma is full of coffee, roasted malt, and bittersweet chocolate. Taste is heavy sweet with a medium duration a bitter oily finish. Full body, great balance, damm fine beer

Schwarz, geringer schaum, malzig/schokoladig im aroma, kaffig im geschmack, feinherb im nachklang. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

color negro opaco con reflejos caoba en los bordes.Aromas de maltas torrefactas, galleta y regaliz. En boca tiene un cuerpo ligero-medio con ligero regaliz acabando a un amargor seco y acafetado muy equilibrado y agradable que se extiende hasta el regusto. Excelente.

Bottle poured into a Pint glass Absolutely black, allows no light even when held to a light source. VERY frothy light brown head, couldnt pour the entire 12 ounce beer at first as the head was near overflowing with 2-3 ounces to go, poured semi-aggressively. Cellar temperature. Strong scent of chocolate, with coffee coming through behind ahead of a hint of toast. Chocolate comes first again when tasting, and a toasty, nutty flavor lingers. The mouthfeel is thick and creamy, extremely pleasant. This is a full bodied beer. The alcohol is remarkably well hidden for a 7.5% abv beverage. An enjoyable Porter at a solid price point, it doesnt astound, but it has definitely opened my eyes to other offerings from Dark Horse Brewing Company.

On tap. Presencia limpia de color negro profundo escasa carbonatacion y gran espuma beige. Aroma a roasted, frutos secos y ligeras notas dulces y licorosas. En boca igual que en aroma. Buen equilibrio con el alcohol

12oz bottle.Pours an opaque black color with deep mahogany highlights and a full and creamy light tan head that holds well and leaves some lace. The nose is fruity and roasty with lots of caramel and some mild floral and grassy hops. The flavor starts with a light sweet fruitiness, that becomes more caramely and creamy as it warms with hints of floral hop flavor, followed by a bold, deeply-roasted coffee bitterness into a dry finish. The body is medium with an exceptionally fine carbonation thats gently crisp and creamy.

Dark and delicious this beer has been in the beer fridge patiently waiting. Dark chocolate should taste this good. Dark black pour with a medium brown head. Aroma is best with a taste to follow and then the finish.
Bottle. Opaque pour, khaki head (about a half finger),no lace. Nose is sweet malt, dark chocolate, coffee. Tastes dry, chalky texture, sweet, roasted malt, chocolate.

Very well done. Aroma is complex with much more sweetness than I expected. Flavor actually delivered on this with some dark fruits at the front leading into a roasted and bitter finish. Discrepancy between the sweet front and bitter finish was a tad jarring but I got used to it. Outside of that, an excellent brew with good balance, nice thickness, and solid mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2013 Undated 12 oz bottle purchased near brewery last month, poured into a snifter. 

A - Pours deep dark brownish-black with a one cm dark tan head that fades quickly to a thin, irregular top coat. Essentialy black body. 

Smell: Lots of dark fruits with hints of dark chocolate, wood and molasses. 

Taste: A load of malts, mostly dark roasted but some sweet too. Some spicy hops, hints of dark fruits, dark chocolate, expresso, burnt toast and light smoke. 

Mouthfeel: Medium+ body; medium-light carbonation. Less smooth than one might reasonably hope. 

Overall: Lots of dark roasted malts, chocolate, and coffee in this one. Its very solid. With the mouthfeel was a bit better.
A yeasty aroma, pours thick and jet black with a tan head. Burnt dark chocolate and coffee flavours. A really good bear

An absolutely outstanding ale that has sat tucked away on the shelves at my favourite beer store, unnoticed by me until now. Cellar temperature and into a snifter. The cap came off with a breath of silence and at first I suspected a flat beer. Pours with not much vigour yet lifts a good inch of tannish cream atop its inky black body. Deliciously thick, sweet and savoury malt and yeast nose reminiscent of Belgian choc fondant, rum balls, liquorice root, humbug candies, Kecap Manis soy sauce, leather and treacle. A light spritz accentuates the front of the palate where some very bitter malt flavours seem to dwell. Chalky and dusty smooth from there on in; not overly heavy in the body department. The soy sauce of the aroma  umami perhaps! - melds well with darkest chocolate (85% cocoa), liquorice and treacly notes all subdued by a lot of earthiness late. Long bitter chocolate, rum-barrel, charred wood and liquorice finish. Alcohol is heated but balances well.  A very harmonious beer that has all the hallmarks of an aged porter. An hour after finishing I could still taste this on my lips. One of those "dont judge the book by its cover" beers. A lovely and complex winter warmer! (12fl.Oz, no date stamp, Cellarbrations Carlisle)

12 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 6/11/2013. Pours pitch black color with a 1-2 finger dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice soapy lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of big dark chocolate, roasted malt, cocoa, coffee, light char, toast, toffee, floral, and roasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of roasted/dark malts; with good strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, cocoa, char, toast, toffee, floral, and roasted earthiness. Moderate roasted bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, char, cocoa, toast, toffee, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Awesome complexity and balance of dark/roasted malt flavors; with a great bitterness/sweetness balance and no cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very creamy, slick, and moderately chalky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is a highly excellent robust porter style. All around great balance and complexity of roasted/dark malt flavors with big robustness; and very smooth to sip on. A highly enjoyable offering.

12 oz bottle. Pours a nice black with a thin dark head that dissipates quickly. The aroma is heavy with coffee and roast, bringing in hints of chocolate and just a touch of booziness. The taste is very similar, but the chocolate seems to be a little more subtle than in the aroma. The mouth feel is actually pretty decent, but just a touch too dry

Bottle thanks to Guyute_Pig: Poured a thick black with a thin whispery tan head. Aroma is dark chocolate and roasted malts. Taste is strong coffee bean with dark chocolate and hint of roasted malt.
Bottle. Black colour with tan head. Roasted malt, chocolate, coffee aroma, with some vanilla. Roasted malt and coffee taste, slightly bitter. Medium to full body.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2013 Tasted from bottle. Color is black with tan head. Good lacing. Aroma of chocolate. Full bodied robust taste. Flavors of chocolate, coffee and caramel. Very good stout! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Champanes. Pours black with a thin brown head. Aroma of raspberry and chocolate. Chocolate, molasses, roasty, creamy, with a bitter finish. Smooth and full mouthfeel. Great!
Bottle. Color black with medium brown head. Aroma malt, roasted, coffee, chocolate. Taste sweet, malt, roasted, chocolate.

Black body with a dark mocha head. Aroma of sherri, roast, chocolate. Taste of roast, coffee, charcoal. Medium to full body, very dry and roasty finish, almost acrid (but only almost). For a porter, its very dry, and I felt it was missing some chocolate note. More like a heavy stout, but nevertheless a good beer.

26 Aug 2013, bottle. black with thick foamy head. nose is bitter roasted malt, oatmeal, dark chocolate. med/thin body and moderately fizzy. rich granola malt, dark chocolate, maybe some molasses and/or tobacco. mild alcohol. Very nice!

Black with a tanned creamy head. Aroma of roasted malts, bitter coffee and hints of raisins and light alcohol notes. Taste is heavy roast with subtle coffee and bitter chocolate. Creamy and full bodied with medium carb. Thumbs up!

Bottle. Pours black with a short lasting light brown head. Aroma is coffee, grass, caramel and chocolate. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Full bodied, creamy texture, soft carbonation and an astringent finish.

Bottle. Pitch black beer with a dark brown and strong head. The aroma is heavily roasted with a hint of malt, and the flavour is deeply bitter and roasted with a mild coffee feel rather than an espresso feel. Overall a nice strongly flavoured stout like beer.

On tap. Pours black with a light brown head. Aroma of roasted malt and chocolate. Taste is toasted malts, lots and lots of coffee and chocolate. Body is between medium and full, but creamy and oily. It's good but has almost too much coffee in the taste. I'd drink it again though. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
At Darkhorse poured black with decent tan headlace. Light nutty aroma. Very smooth medium body nutty taste. Good.

very dark colour, 1 inch brown head; aroma of chocolate, roasted malt and maybe some caramel; taste is totally dominated by roasted bitterness, not too complex porter, maybe some coffee can be felt; too much roastedness for me
Any beer with a donkey on the bottle is going to be a winner in my book. Not usually a fan of porters, but this one gets the job done.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; almost black pour with creamy beige head, mostly coffee aroma with a hint of roast malts, big coffee notes in the taste with an undercurrent of dark chocolate a hint of roast malts quite turbulent carbonation gives a zizzy mouthfeel. Very good.

Reminds me of Breakfast Stout, just a bit thinner. Great aroma and taste of coffee with some chocolate. Very good!

Aromastrong roasty feel, licorice, bold in approach.

Top: medium top with some lace.

12 oz bottle pours black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malts and coffee. Taste is malts, coffee and chocolate.
