Bottle-SA. Deep brown with huge frothy tan head. A: roasted malt, molasses, caramel, oak, chocolate. T: coffee, roasted malt, dark chocolate, ash. Bittersweet. Quite good.
Nice but far too roasted which loses the sweetness of the porter and Id unbalanced. Oh yeah, black amber pour
Poured from a chilled bottle. Dark brown molasses color. Roasted caramel smell. Sweet roasted malt taste.

Pours black with a thin brown head. Coffee and chocolate are the primary aromas. The flavor has them too with a nice amount of hops to balance the sweetness. Very well done.

12 ounce bottle. Pours black with a small brown head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, and coffee. Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, and a bit of smoke. Enjoyed this very much.

Sweet chocolate with hints of coffee and dark fruit on the nose. A deep black pour with a brown ring and no lacing. Medium bitter flavor. Chocolate, roasted malts, and fruit notes, with a bitter coffee-like finish and aftertaste. Medium body with medium carbonation. Overall, a very enjoyable porter. Would drink again.

It had a wonderfull smell. Lots of aroma's you would find in barrel aged beers: koffie, oak, dark chocolat. A light bodied beer, with a strong dark chocolat taste, and a good bitterness, from the hops. The aftertaste is bitter, from the chocolat and the hops and stat for a good long time.

Bottle from bottleselect.com date code unreadable. Pour has a very dark black color with a covering of brown head that fell to a ring on the glass. Aroma has lightly roasted malt, coffee, bitter hops, and some chocolate. Mouth feel is fairly big with a nice coating and medium low carbonation. Flavor is rich on the malt, bitter chocolate, black coffee, creamy, with mild roast.

Bottle sample at a tasting at kerenmks place. Thanks DSG. Pours opaque black with a beige to brown head, aroma of chocolate, chocolate cake and honey, flavor is sweet and smoked with some coffee and dark bread, medium to full bodied

Bottle sample at a tasting at our place. Thanks DSG. Very dark brown-black with tan film. Roasty, cocoa and some ink in the nose, dry, bitter and roasty in the mouth. Bitter and cocoa finish, full body, mildly carbonated.
Draft to taster. Looks good; black with foamy tan head. Smells solid; chocolate malt and roast. Tastes like it smells with a nice, smooth mouthfeel. Good beer.

355ml bottle. Pours an opaque black, with a tiny beige head, which neither lasts well nor leaves much lacing. Bitter coffee and dark chocolate malt notes mix with a slight charry scent to create the aroma. Very mild herbal and citrus hops give way to bittersweet dark chocolate in the mid-palate, with a strong coffee bitterness coming into the finish, along with an odd off-sweet flavour. This offers fairly standard porter flavours, and is a passable effort, although not exactly exciting.
Bottle at Oluthuone Leskinen, Oulu. Originally rated 17052012. Colour is black with small head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, chocolate and roasted malts.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2016 Cask draft at Khyber Pass in June 2013, then regular draft at The Irish Pol in October 2016. Opaque pour with a huge frothy brown head. Large spray of lace. Thick creamy bitter cocoa. Dark roast coffee. Burnt toast. More hints of subtler dark notes in the 2016 version. Faint black current, liquorice and tobacco. Nicely roasty and darkly dry.

Bottle shared at a tasting at kerenmks place. Black-colored with a light brown head. Roasty and coffee-ish aroma. Roasty bittersweet flavor with coffee, dark chocolate and a drier roasty finish. Medium-bodied.

This "black ale/porter has a taste that doesnt fit any neatly into any style.  Deep, opaque black and it looks good in the glass.  Aroma: roasted malt, coffee, and smoke.  Full-bodied on the palate with a good finish.

On tap at Crowbar, april 9th 2013. Black body with a huge dark brown head. Very nice looking. Aroma of cocoa, coffee, flowery hops. Nice thick body, with a taste of mocca, roast, licorice and fruity hops. Quite good. Long lasting aftertaste of roast and bitter hops.
Aroma: caramel and coffee. App: coal black thin but lasting tan he ad. Taste: coffee and bitter chocolate. Palate: full body. Medium length dry finish. Overall: a little bitter for me but enjoyable.

A black beer with a medium and milk-coffee brown head. Aroma is succesfully, roastiness, coffee, balanced lactose and lots of chocolate, pleasant aroma. Taste is strongly roasted, strong black coffee, herbs, some balancing chocolate sweetness. The aftertaste is quite dry, herbal and almost burned. Almost full bodied, smooth to drink. Nice aroma, but the taste is too simple and roasted. Anyway, overally quite enjoyable beer.

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Medium sized, vast & thick and slowly changing beige to brown foamy head on top of a pitch black colored beer.
Aromas of dogfood, roast, iron, roasted barley malts, coffee, spices, mocha, chocolate, light tar and oatmeal roast.
Flavour has a good bitterness, lots of roast, some coffee, barley malt roast, some light cream tones, chocolate, cacao, oatmeal, espresso, floral, liquorice and some liquorice and chocolate drenched hop (bitters).
Like a good stout...
Aftertaste is good bitter, roasty, some coffee and plant tones with a touch of dry chocolate.
Low carbo, soft creamy close to silky mouthfeel, medium to lightly fuller body and a creamy texture.
Nice beer but expected a bit more with 7,5%ABV
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle. Opaque black liquid with small tan head. Aroma of licorice, chocolate, coffee, leather, toffee, port wine and bread. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of licorice, chocolate, coffee and leather. Full bodied with low to medium carbonation.
12oz bottle, oily black in appearance with thin head.  Aroma of chocolate and coffee.  Taste is bitter dark chocolate, coffee and roasted malt.  A solid brew.

12oz bottle shared. Poured opaque brown with dark brown head that doesnt last long. Medium to heavy body. The aroma is not muted at all. Full flavor of roasted malts and chocolate and coffee. The flavor is intensely good with chocolate and coffee and dark roasted malt.  Almost has a dry finish to it. Very good.

Poured into a pint glass black with a tan head that thinned out quickly.
Chocolate coffee scent right off the top.
Definite English style ale with a hoppy background.
Really enjoyed this brew for a black ale.  Definitely will look for another bottle in the future.  Well done Dark Horse!
Very black in color just as it claims. Nice foamy head that lasts the whole time you drink it. Nice chocolate flavor. Not overpowering. Medium bitter taste. Very good.

Black color tan head, looks like any porter...smells roasted notes.  Coffee on the front end, Carmel on the back.  Smooth mouth feel.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.  Near black pour with a thin brown head.  Pleasant aroma with dark chocolate, coffee and vanilla cream.  Deep roasted malt flavor with some hints of chocolate and peanuts.  Finishes with a bitter cocoa and hop mix.  Well carbonated with a mostly dry texture.  Solid.

thick beige mocha head with lacing. coffee coloured. aroma of coffee, alcohol, whisky, vanilla ... complex and very nice on the nose. taste of roasted malts, coffee and liquorice. aftertaste of liquorice, vanilla and whisky. medium body and soft carbonation. really delicious!  bottle 35.5 cl

Bottle. 5/11/13. Pours very dark; deep, dark brown with a thin off-brown head. Aroma is earthy, nutty, chocolate and coffee. Tastes great, similar; roast malts, dark chocolate, iced coffee, earth, nuts. Little lacing. Medium carbonation. Thin mouth feel. Alcohol well-hidden. Excellent. Simple and simply well crafted. Tastes great, looks great, smells and feels great. Drink this beer.

From AC Beer Fest 2013.  The aroma is roasty, chocolate.  the appearance is dark brown, tan head.  The flavor is roasty, hoppy, The finish is roasty, pine, citrus.  Like an imperial stout meets a black IPA.  Pretty good.
A hoppy porter it seems to be.  Pretty tasty stuff.  A dark ale for slightly chilly day.

This was nice. I wouldnt have guessed that it was a porter by the aroma. I got a lot of citrus hops in the nose with some light roast and chocolate. Pour is uhhhh.....black. Flavor is similar, hoppy and balance roasted/chocolate malt. Very nice though.

This was a nice porter. Nothing about it really stands out - but its just a solid brew. There isnt too much earthiness going on here, but the dark chocolate flavor is rich and matches the texture very well. It finishes like a watered-down, black iced coffee with a touch of hops in the end. Thanks for sharing, OmegaX.

Bottle. Black pour with a short, dense brown head. Aroma is strong roasted malt, burnt caramel and bittersweet chocolate. Taste is strong roasted malt, bitter, dark chocolate, burnt caramel, soft coffee notes and powdery cocoa. Body is medium with a dense, bubbly carbonation and strong lingering bitterness. Ends with hop bitterness, bitter, black coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, burnt malt and caramel.

On draft at fat dragon. Black pour with decent tan head.  Big chocolate and toasty notes. Velvety mouth feel is exquisite. Ever so slight alcohol burn on the nose.  Really great. I would have guessed imperial stout.

Half growler from Garden City.  Darkest brown with a tan head and lace.  Roasted coffee dark chocolate and chocolate milk and earthy aroma.  Roasted coffee and dark chocolate sweetness with subdued dark fruit.  Medium bitter roasted coffee very clean finish with some green hops lingering in the nose.  Medium-full body.  Fucking delicious.
Bottle at landmark. Pours pitch black with a medium sized tan head. The aroma has big coffee and milk chocolate, light roast. The taste is bitter chocolate and light coffee sweetness. Very nice.

Bottle @ Délirium Hoppy Loft zwanze day 2012...It pours clear pitch black with small tan head....The aroma is roasted malt, chocolate and coffee....The flavor is roasted malt, chocolate and coffee....

On tap at Crowbar, Oslo. Black with a beige head. Roasty aroma with lots of chocolate, some coffee, dark fruits and licorice. Medium to full body with fairly soft carbonation. Medium sweet and quite chocolaty with a fairly dry and pleasantly bitter finish. Very nice! (2013-03-25)

On tap at Crowbar, Oslo. Black color, good offwhite/ brownish foam. Roasted Aromas, leather , licorice, some malt and dried fruits. Full body & high complexity. Good bitterness- well balanced. Very enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black with a small mocha head.  Smells of dark roasted malt and coffee.  Tastes of coffee, and dark chocolate in the finish

.33l bottle @ Pours pitch black with low tan head. Aroma is lactose, milk chocolate, roasted malts and hint of coffee. Flavor is milk chocolate, roasted to burned malts, coffee. Oily palate. Swell indeed!

Tap a Grand Trunk my first MI beer on location. Pours jet black with beige foamy head. Nose of chocolate and coffee.  Tastes lots of roasted malt, espresso, dark chocolate, burnt toast, earth. Peanuts, maybe some smoke.  Creamy and quite good

Very black indeed, this pours a very dark brown/black color with a slight light brown head. If you didnt know better youd swear it was a stout. There are some robust notes to it with a little sweet sugar too. There is a lot of flavor here for an ale. The texture is smooth, yet it is thinner than a stout. Lots of chalky malts and coffee flavors in the mix. Certainly a very interesting brew.

Bottle.  Cant believe Ive never rated this.  Pours pitch black with a nice foamy brown head that fades quickly.  Big chocolate and roasted malt aroma with just a hint of smoke and bacon.  Taste has just a touch of sweetness that tries to balance out the bitter chocolate, roasted malt, and coffee flavors.  Finish is smooth and creamy, rich, bitter chocolate lingers, some smoke too.  Fairly thick body and creamy mouthfeel.  Delicious stuff that I go back to often.

Really black with tiny tiny hardly noticeable ruby edges, medium brown stable head. Lacing.
Aroma.. intense roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bit licorice, decent hops
Creamy with quite dry finish. Kinda smoked.
Bit sweetish with bitter finish. Great brew, nicely balanced

Appearance: Pours like a porter/stout. Super deep black with a nice little tan head. No lacing, but it still looks pretty nice.

Smell: Much like your typical porter or stout. Heavy on the coffee. Alcohol can be tasted a bit. Chocolates may be in there as well.

Taste/feel: What can I say. Its just a quality beer. I think of it as more of a stout, but thats just me. It has all the qualifications. The thing I can say about this beer is that it seems to be more bitter than most stouts Ive had, so that makes it a little different. The highlight of this beer is certainly the feel. It seems sort of "meh", but if you let it sit in your mouth for a second before you swallow, it gets really nice and creamy, and you get that warmth when you finally swallow.

Overall, a quality beer. As I said a couple times, drinks like a stout. Its a pretty big, deep, rich, coffee flavored beer.
Toasted malt nose. Nice smooth chocolate malt palate with slight bitter finish. Really smooth beer.

Dark. Black.  Delicious.  

Head was almost nonexistent and disappeared quickly.  

Darker in both color and taste than most other beers I've tasted, and that's not a bad thing.  

Strong coffee and chocolate flavor.  Nice beer for a cold night. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 ounce bottle in an American shaker. Aroma is toasted bread, malts, and smoke. Appearance is pitch black, completely opaque, a headlight wouldnt shine through the stuff, and it carries a tan foam on top.  The taste is an old diner blend of cigarette smoke, bitter coffee grinds, and mild acidity. This beer would probably taste amazing with scrambled eggs. Palate is heavy bodied and nicely balance with carbonation. Overall its not my thing because its too bitter and smoky (I prefer my non-imperial porters more subdued) but I can see why the big bold flavors and sturdy texture make it well received by others. Lastly, Id like to know how the cartoon donkey/horse got on one of Dark Horses bolder beers.
Black pour with mocha head. Smells of roasted dark chocolate malt. Taste is burnt coffee, roast dark chocolaten it finishes chalky and bitter with a little sweet.

Aroma is bitter, coffee and dried fruit. Appearance is dark dark brown, one finger beige head. Taste coffee, burnt coffee even. Surprisingly bitter roasted aftertaste. Mouthfeel is perfect, thick and soft carbonation. Overall, its great. My first impression of this beer was an old bottle, and this makes up for that one.
330ml bottle (shared by FatPhil thanks). Pitch black color. Massive brown head. Roast, malty, smoked aroma. Deep roast, malty, bit woody, chocolate in flavor. Full bodied.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a snifter.  Pours black with small dark brown highlights small beige head.  Little lacing, medium/light body, low carbonation, and nice roasted malt aroma.  Taste is bitter roasted malt, poor herbal hops, and hint of bitterness,
Poured from a 12 ounce bottle. Pours a darker brown to Ruby. No head. Aroma is earthy and chocolate bitter. Taste is that earthy bitterness and dark chocolate again. Very bitter overall.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2015 355ml bottle (ALEhouse, Riga) (8:4:7:5:15=3.9)
Rich, almost bacony roasty aroma. Super full, but maybe a bit sticky, if an aroma can be sticky. Loely full taste. Great roast, vey wel balanced. Burnt bacon in the finish too, but such  rich roast its fantastic. Keeps the 7.5 % well hidden. Its clearly not a weak beer, but it doesnt say boozy. I would have bottle after bottle of this beer until I was dragged to the mental asylum. Underrate? Its like like like, but theres no religious experience "wow".
Rerate: 330ml bottle (8:4:8:4:15=3.9)
Still as good. A beautiful roasty stout porter.Still missing the wow, but textbook strong roasty porter. More please!

Definite chocolate/ coffee aroma, but also licorice and molasses as well; theres a charred (not smoked) character here that reminds me of Bourbon. Appearance is dense black with sticky, bubbly mocha head. Flavor really belts away at you with roasty depth, so much so that you wish the beer gave you some sort of sweet respite, but alas, this libation is nigh arid. Palate is medium, oily, and soft. Outstanding in all regards; a beer crafted without ambiguity.
bottle. pours black with off white head. aroma of roasted coco and hops. taste is medium sweet and medium body lots going on hoppy and roasted chocolate pudding

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2013 20/I/13 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: n/a (2013-84) 
Clear dark brown to black beer, big solid irregular beige to brown head (very dark!), stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: mocha, coffee, caramel, chocolate, bit dusty, cocoa powder. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body, smooth creamy texture. Taste: bit sour, mocha, dark chocolate, red berries, bit fruity, hops, bitter, cocoa powder. Aftertaste: coffee, dark caramel, bitter hops, cocoa powder, very dry ending.
12oz bottle shared with friends. This one was quite a treat. Nice aroma of earthy hops mixed with chocolate malts and the slightest bit of coffee grind. Really easy to drink and extremely tasty.

Black in the glass, a nice holding and good sticky head. Lots of chocolate, malts and hops. The coffee gets trough the roasted malts also decent and a nice bitterness. Decent mixture, just misses a small boost for me, just a bit to "plain".
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, chocolate, coffee, nuts and hops. Dry bitter finish.
Bottle from trade with umich03jm. Black pour, thin brown head, malt and hop aroma with hints of chocolate. Taste is dry, roasted malt and somewhat bitter. Finishes fairly bitter.

Pours a nice dark color with a tan head that doesnt last too long. Aroma is nice and toasted with roastated malt and a good amount of chocolate. Flavor is medium  body with a good chocolate bitterness to it and a nice bittersweet flavor on the end which lasts a medium while. Carbonation is average. Overall this is an awesome beer.

Bottle. Pours deep black opaque with a medium dark brown head that dissipates slowly with good lacing in its wake. Aroma is rich and full coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, bourbon, dried fruit. Flavor is similar, light sweet with light coffee bitterness lingering through the finish. Very nice, but doesnt quite live up to the promise of the aroma. A touch of astringence. Full bodied and silky in the mouth. Very nice beer!

Bottle. Black. Nose is roasted, porter / strong porter- like. Loads of dry roasted malts, coffee, and quite a bit of nuttiness. Some wood oak, but it might also be just the nuttiness. Body is mediumthickish. Dry, but not overly. Roasted malts (really, like chewing on them), nuts. Decent strong porter. A bit too explosive on the roasted tones, but goes down well.-- beerbasher/harmattan (N9)

35,5 cl bottle @ OHaras Freehouse. Rated on 17.04.2010
Aroma is somewhat malty with coffee, some dark chocolate and hints of licorice. Flavour is sweetish with malty notes, coffee, semi‐dark chocolate, sugary notes and licorice. Finishes with harsh bitterness. A bit too much on the sweet side.

Bottle: Literally black, stable mid-sized tanned creamy head, moderate to solid dryish aromas of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and leather; solid bitter-sweet flavour, medium to full bodied; lingering leathery-bitter finish. Very good...

Pours a deep black with a one finger, tan head. Aroma smells like a fresh baked chocolate chip cookie sitting next to a cold cup of coffee. Taste is mostly bitter chocolate mixed with some coffee and black licorice. The palate on this bad boy starts out slick and oily and ends with a lingering bitterness. Overall this is one of the top porters out there. A must try.

Was not impressed by this. Weak flavor, very milky/watery/one dimensional. Some dark chocolate notes in the finish. Just not what I was hoping for from this brewery. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Roasted malt aroma with a dark pour and quarter inch head, taste of licorice with a lingering mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.Poured a nice oily black colour with a small brown head.Lots of flavour to this one including coffee, chocolate and liquorice all nicely balanced and some nuttiness too in the background.Nice chocolate finish and aftertaste especially at the end of the bottle when it had warmed a little.Excellent.
Bottle at bar. Black color, brown head. Roasty taste with liquorice, coffee, nuts, a bit of chocolate and a hint of smoke. Full-bodied. Roasty finish with nuts. Awesome brew.
Bottle from Brewfellas. Pours a dark dark oily black colour. Full bodied as can be with a nice brown head. roasty malts, very chocolatey. An amazing beer.

amazing porter.
super thick and dark. strong porter aromas. 
chocolate and coffee flavors.
super long and nice aftertadte

Totally black liquid in the glass. A lot of stuff in the nose: Roasted malts, choco, coffee, caramel...
Roasted malts, coffee, toffee in mouth. A really good porter.

355 ml bottle @ Olutravintola Konttori, Tampere.
Pours pitch black color with a small head. Aroma of dark roasted malts, licorice, burnt malts actually, dried fruits and caramel. Flavour of dark berries, dark roasted malts, mild caramel, ash dry chocolate, cocoa powder and caramel. Dry malty palate with a chocolaty finish. More complex than I recalled, excellent.
4426

12 oz bottle, Whole Foods Columbus.  "Black Ale," not "Black Bier."  This one was unexpected.  The pour had me immediately expecting a stout or a porter and not a black ale, and I was right; very dark almost-opaque brown; 1-finger dark burnt-sienna Alf-colored head, dissipating into a ring.  Aroma roast, chocolate, lightly coffee.  Flavor similarly roasty, coffee, chocolate.  Medium-thick, frothy in the mouth, lightly sticky.  In my experience, true black ales tend to be a bit thin and watery and so Im not generally a fan.  However, this beer clearly went toward porter/stout.  This would have been better if theyd gone full-porter, but as "black ales" go, this is outstanding.  As a porter, not especially complex or extraordinary but still well above average.
This bizarre little Ale is a winner. Ive actually put it up against top level Stouts and it fares well, but when put up against most Porters this is one of the best there is!
Black colour. Coffee chocolate aroma. Taste roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and some hops

12 fl oz. bottle. Nice coffee and dark chocolate aromas, along with some caramel ones. Pours very dark, black, with a very thin tan head, vanishing, poor lacing. Despite this is average carbonated, medium body and oily textured. Taste is roasted malt, bitter cocoa, coffee, some caramel notes. A nice porter. Enjoyable.

Pours a thick black with dark Carmel head that is thin without much retention. Aromas of a little roasted malt and chocolate. Taste is short at first with roasted malt and chocolate. Finish is slightly boozy. Mouthfeel is pretty good, not to heavy,but not viscous enough. Pretty good black

If I can read both my label, as the pic joined its called Black ALE, not "Bier"... Medium, rusty-brown head over virtually black beer. Velvety, thick, alcoholrich nose, with impression of warm spirits; sweet and very roasted; hot metal slugs, bit of coffee and burnt cake. Very roasted, bitterish flavour; scorched syrup; mocha. Finish has something lighter - green leaves, some hop. Slighlty burning MF, well-carbonated feel; thick, viscous body. Nice, but not unusual.

Opaque black with a long tan head cover and heavy streaks of lace.  The taste is creamy chocolate and vanilla malt with some natural bittering that provides a velvety smooth palate that arrives nicely at a long-lasting finish with more chocolate and added alcohol warmth.  A superb brew.  Highly recommended.

Bottle. An opaque black beer, with a small, frothy, lacing, mostly diminishing, brown head. The aroma is moderately malty (roasted grain, black chocolate, cocoa, hint of coffee), lightly hoppy (grapefruit), with a strong note of vanilla, some licorice. The flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, velvety/creamy texture, average carbonation, very long finish with moderate to heavy bitterness, lightly to moderately alcoholic. Very nice rendition, lots of dark chocolate and vanilla in the nose, licorice-like feel in the flavor. Rather bitter, but not due to the hops. Interesting.

from bottle. pors a dark thick brown-black colour and a beige, two-finger frothy head. complex aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, mokka, red berries and dark fruits. hmm, smells absolutely amazing! however the flavours are a bit weak and thin compared to the aroma. initial sweetness and fruitiness (berries and dark fruits) os being followed by a long lasting bitterness. i had expected a bit more complexity...however, the mouthfeel is creamy and the beer is warming up the throat. could be better though!

(From notes 7 Nov, 2012) Bottle. Not much foam (due to glass and slow pour). Almost black pour. Aroma is chocolate, coffee and a bit of smoke; all as a great combination. Flavor is mocha, malty, not sweet. Very creamy mouthfeel. Finish is malty bitter. Fantastic beer.

Tap at Kaseys Tavern, Chicago - 03/11/12.
Black with a decent coffee coloured head which retains well.
Nose of roast malt, chocolate, touch of coffee.
Tastes of roast malt, milky chocolate, mineral tones.
Fuller end of medium bodied with soft carbonation leading to a dry finish.
Decent!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
On tap at the brewery. Nice strong flavor, interesting mix of styles. Perfect on a cold day

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at konttori, tampere. Black color with brown head. Nice aroma of licorice, roasted malts, sweetness. Quite nice taste of roasted malts, sweetness, some hops.

33cl bottle. Black with medium brown head. Nose : chocolate butter, peanuts, some coffee. Some honey. Sip : full body, low carbonation, creamy texture. Sweet with notes of nuts and chocolate, long finish with sweet and coffee bitterness. Really tasty beer.

12oz bottle procured from the beer fridge at the lake.  Pours a deep, dark brown color with a brown head.  Aroma is nutty, roasty, chocolate.  Medium on the palate with soft carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, roasty, coffee, chocolate, with a bittersweet chocolate finish.  Pretty tasty.

36cl, no mention of ABV, as Dark Horse Reserve Special Black Ale, American brew, from Geers Oostakker, complex Porter, roasted/malty and slightly woody/spicy, very balanced, hazy, small head, very good brew, yet expensive

Pours very black with slight brown head to it.  Over did it on the black patent and roasted malt

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours an opaque black with 1 finger tan head with medium to heavy lacing. Prominent roasted malt and espresso. Little chocolate that is expressed, but I dont miss it. Bitter citrus hops that is subtle, but very good. Full bodied with moderate to lively carbonation. Long bitter finish.  This is a good bitter porter.

Bottle. Pours black with a nice tan/brown head that fades to a thin halo. Not much carb on this bottle though. Loose lacing. Aroma is big whiffs of chocolate and vanilla. Taste is perfect roast, nothing burnt or overwhelming here. A smoky taste lingers. Very drinkable and warming.

Black as black.
Nose was dusty,mellow chocolate/nuts an earthy dirty musty almost.Like the earthy smell of beets.
Taste is very smooth,slick,strong roast but not harsh or astringent,strong massive chocolate,thick rich maltiness,strong bittering,PIney I think,all the chocolate coffee.roast makes it hard to distinguish but it is bitter. In a nice kind of way.Seems as strong as 5 shots of espresso.

Draft. No aroma. Black. Brown head. Great lacing. A bit to coffee type for me but its still yummy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Reserve Special Black Bier is a full bodied ale.  It has unique flavors of coffee and chocolate. The color of this beer is black, and when pured into a glass it will have a deep brown head of foam.

Csakajósör, Budapest. Nagyon szép, teljesen fekete színe és közepes méretű, kitartó, krémes világosbarna habja van. Illatában azonnal érezni a finom pörkölt malátás, égetett cukros aromákat, keserű fekete csokoládéval és frissen pörkölt kávéval. Ízében még kiérezni egy kis édeskés fűszerezettséget és kevés gyógyfüves komlót, nagyon ott van. Testes, de mégis nagyon jól iható, kellemesen szénsavas és száraz. Amolyan igazi tengerentúli porter, nem lehet benne csalódni.

12ozer from Unclerudy! Thanks much brotha. Deep black pour with a towering coffee colored head. Talk about a roasted malt bonanza....dannnng. Roasted malts, coffee, a tinge of caramel, and some smoke. Super dry on the finish but nice body. Roasty troughout and finishing full. I would love to have this on the shelf at my local liquor store.....

Oil black pour. Brown head. Smell in order of perceiving them is coffee, then dark fruits, then chocolate. Taste is likewise. I also get some oak and roast. It then turns sour, then bitter, then slightly sweet. This beer is a trip. EXCELLENT ABV balance for such a highly alcoholic porter.

Beautiful midnight black body gives rise to a dark chocolate nose and flavor. An aftertaste of chocolate covered cherry and coffee came through with a nice but not excellent silky mouthfeel that great porters boast. Probably more stout than porter in the taste, this brew is worth a look..or two, or three.
Tap at Craft back in April. Sketchy rating, I had had a few. Aroma is soy sauce, roast malt, bit of light coffee. Taste is chocolatey, roasty malt, bit of cream. Tasty and nice.

Bottle at GBF 2012-09-07 Göteborg
AP: pitch black, frothy brown head
AR: truffel chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, candis
F: à bit like the Dog A, sugary sticky feeling, warming feeling, lovely chocolate, wee grape fruit
From a bottle at GBF 2012. Black with small beige head. Slightly sugary chocolate and coffee roasted aroma. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Semi sweet with low bitterness.
Really solid porter. Big roasty chocolate nose with an excellent delivery on the palate. Good alcohol presence is warming, but not overly noticeable. Great chocolate notes on the finish
8/11/12. GTMW. Black pour with a nice tan head. Nice roasted malts, coffee, and dark chocolate on the aroma. The flavor is much the same but with a touch of creaminess as well. Tasty!

Pours black with a short dark brown head.
Scent is smoky, roasted, chocolate malt.
Taste is dark chocolate bitter and a bit of licorice....some coffee grounds.
Very nice dark bitter to this one, slightly thin, but great flavour......I like it.
Puzzled by the label art, however....an apologetic-looking donkey and what appears to be Napoleon being struck by lightning?
Is the Donkey named Elba?
Just wondering.

Nice dark color and caramel colored foamy head, fairly strong coffee smell and taste, hints of chocolate and mollases, smokey / roasted flavor dominates .  Goes down smooth.  A little bitterness but fairly mellow overall.  Good medium body porter type beer. Went well with pork chops.
Dark and chocolate in taste. Builds a nice head when poured.  Very strong taste up front with mild aftertaste.
Draft. Aroma is dark chocolate, licorice, roasty. Black color, tan wispy head. Flavor is chocolate, bitter. Overall a full flavor beer, bitter and chocolately.
From a bottle poured a dark brown color with a fair amount of head.  Light toasted malty flavor with a qukck finish.

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours black with a half finger of dark tan head. Aroma is mostly coffee with a good bit of chocolate. Taste is medium bitter. Lots of coffee and some dark chocolate. Light bodied with a somewhat thin texture. Lively carbonation and a very long coffee finish. Overall, pretty darn good. I would gladly drink this again. I think the coffee flavor is going to stay with me all night.

I quite liked this but wasnt quite sure what it was .. . pours a deep brown .. light head, medium lacing .. . deep roast, tar, and moses .. . slick mouthfeel .. . up to the dark horse standard .. . . butcher by trade.
Really nice dark beer. Good coffee and roasted notes to it in both smell and taste. Remarkably light for a porter. Interesting...
Bottle. Pours almost black with a thick tan head. Lots of coffee in the aroma, with roasted malt. Chocolate in the flavor, along with anise and a bit of burnt toast.
Poured from a 12 ounce bottle. Notes of coffee, chocolate, slight caramel, roast malt. A very nice rich Schwartz beer. A great beer.

Bottle from Beermerchants.com. Pours pitch black with a moderate sized creamy tanned head. Aroma is vinous with some coffee and liquorice. Taste is cold coffee,hard roasted malts,liquorice and dark bitter chocolate. Ends dry and smooth, very likeable.

Pours a murky black with a very small tan head that recedes quickly. Leaves a small lacing. Lots of dark chocolate, roasted coffee, bread, some oak, and alcohol on the aroma. You first get the oaky chocolate flavor, then get some bitterness from the hops in the middle, and finishes with the roasted coffee. Although there is some alcohol on the aroma, it does not show through in the taste. It is between a medium and full body with light carbonation. It is somewhat oily and creamy on the palate. Bitter coffee flavor lasts on the finish. This is listed as a porter, but it is seems more like a cross between a porter and a lighter stout to me. Not bad.

Dark brown-black with temporary cola head. Savoury, licorice and wood nose. Spiky carbonation, chocolate, quite thin bodied again. Touch of roast barley, chocolate and vanilla in the finish. A grower but still quite strange

Black pour, thick brown head.  Not as heavy as I like for a porter, but, full/medium bodied.  Great tasting roasted and chocolate malts, good balance, complexity, warming alcohol finish.  Good brew!  I remembered why I like porters.
Pours solid opaque black with small head. Aroma is malt, coffee, licorice. Not very sweet and has a mild bitter finish. Mouthfeel is slightly thin, with a medium to full body.

Bottle. Thick black pour with a nice tan head that doesnt move. Nice aroma, chocolate, vanilla, dark fruits, prunes. Similar taste, chocolate with vanilla, ovaltine, little molasses. Perfect balance and smooth on the palate, little sweetness. Very nice

Bottle shared with ling at Jm curley in Boston. pours pitch black with tab lacing. Aroma is roast and chocolate. Mouthfeel is medium and creamy, with notes of chocolate, roast, light bitter hop and milk.

I had no idea when I bought this that it was so highly rated. This is one murky porter, it looks like imperial stout. Pure oily goodness. Heavy king-size chocolate bar roasted malt aroma, and some distant hops to back it up. The flavor is intensely sweet, but the most stand out part is actually the bitter sting that rolls over the sweetness.  This beer is weighty in a way that kills seals and seagulls. Exactly what a porter should be.

Aroma of caramel, roast coffee, and cocoa.  Pours black with a brown filmy head.  Taste is pine forward with a nice fruit and roast coffee mouthfeel.  Roasty, sweet and just bitter enough to be awesome.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2012 Bottle.  Great looking brew - black pour with nice dark brown head, stick brown lacing.  Taste is bitter hops and far roasted, almost burnt coffee. Just big bold java all over.  Some bitter chocolate, tobacco and smoke as well.  This beer is big and in your face.  Full mouthfeel.  Great beer.

Nice dark opaque black color with a small head. Nose is all coffee and chocolate with some alcohol. Taste is dark burnt coffee with some floral notes. Finish is dry, somewhat bitter and short. Quaff Score 6 / 10
Pours a dark brown with a brown head and heavy, sweet chocolate aroma. Taste is toasty, of roasted malt and chocolate with warming alcohol and a smooth, dry finish.
Fra fat på Cafe Baran, Bergen: aroma full av røstet malt og smaken er også nydelig. Kaffe, mørk sjokolade og fint balansert. Mykt karbonert, god munnfylde. En nydelig kraftporter med lang ettersmak.

On tap at CRAFT Beer Co, London on 7th May 2012. Jet black with tan head. Rich, yeasty and smoky aroma. Intense chocolate, citrus, smoke and Christmas cake in-mouth. Pungent earthy aftertaste, with hazelnut, berries and rich fruitcake.

50cl on tap. Awesome porter, all black with a beautiful light-brown head. It smelled roasted coffee and dark chocolate, there where also some hints of licorice. The taste was more or less the same. Full bodyed, dry, soft carbonation. I would recommend it!

On tap at Baran, Bergen. Pours a pretty black colour with a nice medium brown head. Aromas of delicious coffee, chocolate and some fruit. The flavour has a even more pronounced coffee touch with dark bitter chocolate, and some salt and roasted malt. Soft mouthfeel but still a bit sparkly. Bitterness = medium+. A solid and well-balanced porter. I enjoyed every sip.
Pours black with a reddish tinge and a brown head. Aroma of resiny hops, burnt malts, chocolate, and coffee. Strong smokey taste, creamy texture, and astringent finish. Alcohol is masked by smoke.

355ml bottle @ Malja, Kuopio

Pours pitch black with a smooth foamy light brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, with notes of wood, tobacco and vanilla. Taste is roasty with some notes of wooden ash, tobacco and coffee. Finish is smooth and slightly roasty with some hints of dry wooden notes. Okay, quite well balanced and tasty.

This is a great beer. Dark and roasty with a perfect mouthfeel. I would almost call it a stout. A lot of dark malt backbone and seriously roasted char. A wonderful beer that I would be glad to have again.

25 cl. draft @ Delirium Hoppy Loft // pitch black with a medium tanned head // mocha, coffee, dash cocoa, mellow chocolate, roasted malts (mellow at first, slightly more in the back), slight hops & hop bitterness in the back, slightly rough in finish // velvety & smooth // quite a lovely porter
Draught. Rich chocolate and coffee nose. Pitch black with a brown head. Creamy and smooth. Roasty with chocolate and a touch of alcohol. Well rounded but some lingering fusels.
Pours dark brown with a small head. Aroma dark malts, hops, roasted coffee. Strong palate, very dry. Not Bad.
tap at Mikkeller Bar. Black with a nice beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, vanilla, chocolate, caramel and coffee.
Thick and black with smells of dark chocolate and tart cherries.  Highly roasted flavors balanced with smooth dark chocolate, dark fruits, toast and hints of coffee.  Extremely smooth.
Draught @ Mikkeller. Dark pour. Vanilla, coffee, toffee, caramel, dark chocolate. Medium body, bitter finish.

Color: black with a lightbrown foamy head. Nose: Coffegrounds, smoked ham, dark chocolate, vanilla, burnt sugar. Taste: Espresso, last sip of your coffe, coffegrounds, vegatable, cucumber, dark chocolate. Bitter finish.

Silky blackness...the palate on this one is so velvety rich you will wish you could rate it higher than a 5. For some reason, I always under-appreciate this when it is offered but I am always pleased when I honor the offer. Awesome.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text:
Apposite of its name, nary a ray of light is to be seen! Utterly and totally opaque black. The darkness beckons...

A sweet olfactory ballet of coffee, toffee, caramel dark sweet roasty flavors. 

A slight bitterness is overtaken by the bittersweet chocolate that blooms on the palate. A pleasant bitterness lingers, yum.

Despite the execrable aesthetic, Im beginning to like Dark Horse...

Tried @ Beer Temple, Amsterdam. Pitch black opaque color, medium sized light brown head. Smell malts, dark malts, roasted malts, a lot of coffee, slightly peat, ash and mocca. Taste mocca, coffee, dark and roasted malts, ash, slightly some hops and bitter. Medium to full body, medium carbonation.

12oz bottle courtesy of Beerman6686 as part of Ratebeer Free Beer Week! thanks so much, Dan! pours a gorgeous, syrupy, onyx topped by a thick, creamy (almost whipped) head of dark mocha that leaves rich stains of lace on the glass. aroma is fantastic with rich bakers chocolate, hershey bars, and black coffee backed by notes of walnuts, Heath Bar, smokey earth, and a hint of blackberry. flavor is outstanding as well with heavy roasted coffee, hazelnut creamer, toasted malts, and cocoa up front backed by salted, mixed nuts, earthy hops, sweet toffee, and subtle, sweet but tart blackberry notes that carry over from the aroma. palate is simply perfect, silky-smooth, with almost frappe-like texture with light carbonation and a dry, roasted, slightly sweet finish. overall, one of the best porters ive had in a while. they should definitely let this spend some time in bourbon barrels. it would be magic.
Pitch black with a foamy head, leaving a nice lace. Vinous aroma with a hint of burnt coffee, and dark chocolate, with a bitter finish.

Bottle from CP&K. It pours opaque black, with a thick tan head. The nose is roasted malt, salted liquorice, coffee, dark chocolate and caramel. The taste is roasted malt, bitter chocolate, salted liquorice, tar, treacle and coffee, with a dry finish. Medium body and low carbonation. Very easy drinking.

bottle, from pilsen xmas beer markets in cernice. black with a thin brown head; rich aroma of chocolate thickshake, chocolate cake mix, guatemalan coffee; full-bdied and luscious texture; hints of coffee cream, well-balanced with some burnt bitterness; very lassy indeed

355 ml bottle. Malmö, Sweden.
Pitch black colour with tiny tan head.
Roasted malt, touch of coffee, deep maltiness and some mild sweetness in vinous and very dark aroma. Ash, roasted malt and some bitterness in vinous and very dark flavour. Oily palate.

Tap @ Beer Temple. Color is, ehm, black. Beige to brown head, good lace. Aromas: hard roasted malt, drop/licorice, laurel/bay leave, fruit retronasal. Flavor is medium sweet, a bit sour fruit, drop. Medium body. Finishes ashy and bitter. Porter? Id say a cross between stout & BIPA. Nice.

draft @ Delirium Hoppy Loft.
Brune foncée, col moka léger laissant un léger filament doré sur le verre.
Arôme de levure, houblonné avec un très agréable bouquet malté grillé/caramel et juste une pointe de fruit aigre.
En bouche, malté/chocolaté note fruit noir, amertume moyenna et chocolatée le tout sur une amertume houblonné qui simmisce entre ce profile qui reste dominé par le malt. Sur la fin le palais gagne en note torréfiée sur un palais légèrement poudreux. Houblon reste discret tout au long et contribue à une bonne balance damertume.
a nicely balanced porter, not to sweet not to salty, not to sour. and a good hop bitternes to boot. lovely, top marks to dark horse brewing.

From notes.
Pours a nice black with a sticky light brown head that leaves a very nice lacing down the glass.
Smell is rich with roasty malt and a little sweet fruit.
Taste is well balanced with carmely roasted malt and a nice bitter coffee like finish. 
Carbonation is nice and bright, its pretty smooth around the mouth, nice bier.

Pitch black, opague colour with a nice brown head. Smells coffee, dark chocolate and liquorice. Tastes coffee, dark chocolate, burned and roasty. Full body, great carbo and a nice silky thickness. Great beer!

Rich dark brown/black color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of toasted malt, chocolate, & coffee; Flavor of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, hops, and some black licorice; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced & complex; Very good overall.

On tap @ Csak a jó sör,Budapest. A black coloured beer with a thick,massive brown head. The aroma is roasty, coffee-like. The taste is bitter-sweet with notes of coffee, dark chocolate and hoppy bitterness. Full bodied, oily textured.

On tap at Csakajósör, Budapest. Poured black, with a creamy beige foam. Dark chocolate, anise, molasses, espresso, vanilla in the delicious aroma.  Full bodied, oily, low carbonation. One of the best porters I ever had for sure.

Bottle at Mogwai. Helsingborg, December 2011. 

Sweet aromas of coffee, vanilla, cacao and chocolate. Soft and light body with a rich smooth taste of chocolate and roasted malt. A great and tasty beer!

Bottle at the Kernel with Paul and Evin. Oily black pour with a creamy, beige head. Some lightly tangy, dark and roasty aroma, bit of charcoal, some dusty cocoa. Medium sweet with some dry, earthy cocoa. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Sweet finish, some burnt grass and toast, cocoa, dirt. Very nice.

Csak a jó sör, Budapest.
Szén fekete színe van, habja  hatalmas kőkemény, világos barna és igen kitartó. Illata csokis, kakaós, kissé fás, füstös, malátás. Az íze édeskésen, csokoládésan, malátásan kezd, ami aztán át megy egy igen intenzív fás, füstös, kávészemes kesernyés fanyarságba, amit a komló is alaposan megtámogat a maga gyantáival. Olajos, elég nehéz teste van, alig szénsavas. Utóíze kissé fanyar, keserű és nagyon száraz. Brutálisan jó, fajtája egyik klasszikusa.

Draught @ Csakajósör, Bp.
Pitch black colour with a creamy brown head.
Smell and aroma are ruled by intensive roasted malt escorted by brown sugar, chocolate, earth and dried fruits, texture is oily.
It finishes long and dry with dark chocolate underpainted gently by some alcohol.
Serious, fine one.

Bottle. Black color with a tan head that fade away quickly and keep a lace until the end.Aroma is full of senses... Roasted malt, dark chocolate, dark fruits as plum. Flavor is pour roasted malt and coffee, hints of chocolate and dark fruits, so creamy beer... Mouthfeel is Bitter caffee and chocolate!!! LOVELY!!!!

On tap at Csakajósör, Budapest. Clear black color with creamy dark brown head. Coffee and chocolate aroma with hops. Bitter chocolate aroma with coffee, grassy and spicy hops, a bit flower and some yeast. Very delicious. Medium bitter taste. Medium body with creamy texture and average carbonation. Coffee, chocolate finish. Very delicious Porter, bitter, but intensive chocolite one. Dry, a bit smoky. Bitter, but well-ballanced beer.
Gyönyörű sötét barna hab. Alkoholos de nem tolakodó alkoholos illat. Erős keserű kávés íz. Csoki, hamu, fém. A legjobb porter amit ittam. Még, még, még! Csöccs!!!

On tap at Csakajósör, Budapest.
Poured as a black hole, fine creamy small beige head. Aroma of dark chocolate, molasses and coffee, anise, burnt wood. Strong roasted character, coffee and dark chocolate, oily character, mocca and vanilla, caramel. Fantastic!

Bottle from Breeze Thru. Pours cola colored with a light tan head. Aroma has sweet cocoa nibs and dark roasted coffee. Lovely! Taste brings roasted coffee, bittersweet chocolate and a hint of dark fruit. Finishes medium length; bittersweet. Very little alcohol presence. We missed Marshall during our last MI trip, but I think it is mandatory next time. This porter finished behind Founders in our tasting a few years back - but I am curious for a head-to-head again. My memory would say Founders is more creamy, but this is really good.

Bottle/12oz - Pours a very back in color with a medium tan head that produced some very nice thick lacing on the glass.  Aroma is heavy with coffee and chocolate... and perhaps a bit of herbal hops. Flavor is mostly about the coffee and chocolate, but the flavors of the dark roasted malts and earthy hops do come through.  Lingering medium to strong bitterness... Quite enjoyable
DRAFT at Dark Horse....great place by the way....pours black with tan head...nose of chocolate and coffee...tastes thick...great mouthful...and same favors come thru....very tasty...

Aroma is fruit, either apricot or tangerine along with earthy malts.  The flavor is similar to the aroma, although the earthiness is slightly stronger and is mixed with a coffee bitterness.  This was pretty good, the flavor was roughly a porter but kind of its own style, hard to categorize but unique and a good ale all around.

12 oz bottle. Black colour with a thi layer of light brown head that quickly dissapear. Aroma is strong toasty, licorice and black coffee. Flavour is toasty, malty, dark coffee, alcoholic, dense on palate and a final moderate bittery and long with an aftertaste toasty. Carbonation is soft to flat. Body is medium to high. Teture is oily.
12 ounce bottle purchased at Archer Liquors by Midway-Chicago airport for $10.79/6-pack Very good!

Bottle.  Wood, ash and chocolate malt aroma.  Dark brown-black color with small head.  Slightly sweet chocolate malt, wood, and moderately bitter herbal hops flavor.  Body on the light side.  Not bad - would have liked a stronger malt flavor.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2012 (Bottle) Pours black with a medium brown head. The aroma is medium roasted and light burned with notes of cocoa, espresso, caramelized nuts, blackberries and green hops. Dark fruits in the background. The flavour is dry, near heavily bitter and light acidic. Burned molasses, cocoa, coffee and resinous/citric hops. The mouthfeel is round and tart from the hops and roast. Acidic and bitter finish.  Medium to full bodied. Nice, maybe just a tad too acid-ish.

I humbly suggest to the Lords of RateBeer that Reserve Special is far closer to a black IPA than a porter. It has a sharply bitter taste to go along with a light, thin body. Yes, there is a hint of chocolate in the aroma, but not much of a head could be coaxed from the pour and there is none of the roastiness or heft typically found in a porter. The long, dry, bitter finish again is far closer to an IPA or pale ale than any other style.

Pours opaque dark brown with dark brown head and moderate retention.  Aroma is milk chocolate, oatmeal, coffee, licorice.  Taste is more like an oatmeal stout than a porter; somewhat sweet yet highly roasted.  Body is thick and chewy, low carbonation, roasty finish is not overly aggressive.  Overall, rich and delicious.

12 oz bottle poured into a snifter is black as night with a tan head.  Aromas are chocolate, coffee, and a hint of licorice.  Taste is mostly roasted malt and coffee with nice bitterness to balance.  The body is medium, which if it were heavier would make a great stout.  Overall, very pleased with this one.

Bottle.  Black color (no, really), massive dark brown head with great retention and solid yet delicate lacing.  Aroma of licorice, dark chocolate syrup, vanilla.  Taste is boozy chocolate, burnt espresso.  Fantastic.
Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee and dark chocolate. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter finish. Oily. 261211
Had this one on draught at the Franklin Tap in Chicago, Illinois.  Nice and malty with a good alcoholic finish.

bottle received in trade  black pour with light edges minimal head.  aroma of slight malt and roasted things.  mouthfeel was med to thin; this was good; kinda of a cross between a black ale and porter/stout.
the chocolate flavor in this porter makes it really interesting and so easy to drink, cuts the head off the roasty flavor of a porter, but still really good.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2016 Bottle at home. Clear black with a light brown head. Aroma heavy malty (roasted, burnt, licorice). Flavor moderate sweet and bitter. Medium body. Really nice! 12.12.2011
Draught at Himmeriget, same good experience.

Pours, as one would expect, a deep dark black.  Nice off white head.  Aroma is heavy with chocolate and a bit of coffee and caramel. Very malty, but certainly not without its hops.  Taste is just as nice as the aroma, with coffee being the dominant flavor this time.  Very very enjoyable.

Tap @ Dark Horse. Deep brown appearance with a dark brown head. Roasty, dull chocolate malty, light espresso, light nutty aroma. Pretty rich chocolate malty, roasty coffee, bitter piney hoppy flavor. Fairly intense yet tasty flavor.

Phenomenal brew - not overly surprised when I saw the high rating here. This is a fantastic combination of chocolate aroma with a roasted, but slightly bitter finish. Excellent choice for most any occasion. Dont be thrown off by the goofy logo, its well worth the try. I definitely see myself enjoying this one again in the near future.
Love it.  Pours a black color with a caramel soapy head.  Aroma of roast, chocolate, and dark fruit.  Bitter chocolaty taste with some sublte notes of dark fruit.  Damn tasty.  Love the roastiness.

Bottle @ Schouskjelleren, shared with unknown number of Ratebeerians around my table. Pours a black body with a small off-white head. Nose is - surprisingly - tobacco snuff (first one!), licorice, hints of dark malts and roasty coffee tones. Very nice. Taste brings forth licorice, roasted malts, coffee, leather and burnt toast. Dry mouthfeel, complex and very nicely tuned. Very, very solid porter from Dark Horse, a brewery that only recently has started impressing me.
A black beer with a brown head. Taste and aroma is very dominated by chocolate, too much for my palate, still a very enjoyable beer. (Bottle)

Dark opaque black with a tan head.  Earthy spicy scent.  Malty?  Black Licorice.  Extremely bitter taste.  Im told this is a true porter which tells me that Im not big a fan of porters.  Far too bitter.  Slightly warming with a bite in the back of the throat.  Im sure others will love this.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2013 Pours mahogany into deepest black with the advertised deep brown head. Nose is roasty and chocolaty. Taste is nicely balanced between sweet and bitter. Palate is full but not heavy. This beer is pretty close to being a stout for a porter. At 7.5% ABV, this is a tasty after-dinner beer perfect for a brisk fall evening. Another very nice offering from Dark Horse.

Bottle.
Pitch black with a dark brown head.
Aroma: roasted malt, granola, oatmeal, chocolate.
Taste: roasted, coffee, chocolate, licorice, oatmeal cookies, a slight acidity, medium bitter.
Smooth, medium-bodied, quite a high carbonation.

Bottle to a pint glass.  Pours a pitch black, with limited and quickly dissipating head.  Rich coffee/chocolate aroma.  Very rich, smooth sweet finish.  Excellent.  Best beer Ive had from Dark Horse.
Had someone bring to me from Grand Trunk Pub in Detroit.  Poured Black tasted bitter great beer.
Bottle at Bishops Arms Vasagatan. Pours pit black with a small, light brown head. Nice roasted coffee, molasses and peaty aroma. Good roasted flavours, some sweet caramel, quite dry finish. Solid.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Nonic Imperial Pint.

Appearance: Pure black with thin brown head and light lacing lines.

Aroma: Roasted aroma, but quite sweet - molasses, cookies & cream, chocolate, vanilla, licorice and something reminiscent of a Christmas tree.

Taste: Strong roasted flavor but fairly creamy and sweet. Chocolate, light coffee, cream, licorice, molasses and pine. Ends somewhat bitter, but a nice touch of creamy sweetness remains throughout. Tastes like a blend of a Stout, a Cafe Mocha and, more some reason, Anchor Christmas Ale.

Palate: Relatively low carbonation. Body is creamy, silky and smooth, but surprisingly not quite full-bodied.

Overall: Very nice - both very complex and easy to drink. BA and Dark Horse both claim this is not a Stout, but surely it is a Stout of some kind. It seems like a ramped-up, bitter and higher alcohol Cream Stout, with a strange dash of holiday spirit.

Bottle 12FL.OZ from erzbierschof.ch. Pours heavy and black, small tobacco foam. Lavish and rich nose, malted sweetness, cocoa, espresso, with a bitter of burnt, vanilla and raisin. Goes away for long on dark chocolate, burnt, and a dry stout trend.
Bottle.  Black beer, dark tan head.  Pours thick and full.  Strong coffee, chocolate and roast aroma. Full mouth feel still with some carbonation.  The finish lingers and can be a little astringent.

Bottle at Brew Haven festival. Sweet chocolate, coffee, and smoke aroma. Near black with a small tan head. Dark roasted malt and coffee flavor. A little lighter bodied than I was expecting, and maybe slightly tannic.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2011 Pitch black beer pours with a thin layer of mocha coloured head.  Smells of drk chocolate, cocoa beans, a hint of coffee, roasted malts.  Strong roasted taste - coffee, bakers chocolate, bitter grapefruit - would go awesome with a cigar.  Medium bodied, medium carbonation - somewhere between a good imp stout, porter and black IPA>  Highly recommended.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2015 12oz bottle from Dutchs. Looks like a stout. Pitch black, big tan head. Beautiful. And delicious! Loving this brand more and more, wow. Heavenly roasty chocolatey aroma, but very smooth, light tasting and drinkable. perfect carbonation. What a great beer. 8/4/7/4/16 Update rate, 5/7/15:Excellent thick chewy texture. Touch of smoke. Dark chocolate. Mild to moderate roast malt. Some earthy hop. Little ring of head, few bits of lace. Moderate bitter, moderate sweet, good balanced taste. An excellent porter.

Bottle. Black beer with a great lasting creamy brown head. Bitter chocolate aroma, metal, cocoa, coffee, quite roasted. Coffee flavor, cocoa, roasted, bitter, iron notes, dark chocolate. Bitter finish with chocolate and iron.
From bottle at home in Skövde. Dark, full body. Creamy small head. Chocolate, coffee both aroma and taste.Medium bitterness,

Poured a total darkness black with brown head (lacing).  Heavy aroma of chocolate and some roasted malt.  Med sweetness, Lite bitter.  Med-heavy body, thick and creamy texture.  Soft carb.  A good porter, smooth and full of cocoa.  Ends on bitter note.

Is this a porter or an Imperial stout? Wow! Aroma is a lot of chocolate, espresso and a solid amount of roasted malts and vanilla.  Taste follows with some lingering bitterness and roasted flavors after the finish. Incredibly well balanced between the malt, coffee, chocolate and bitterness. Has a medium/ fuller body. Almost a velvety mouthfeel that ends with a nice bitter chocolate and dry finish.  Really a well put together porter.  A great buy for $2.95 for a 12 oz bottle @ Julios in Westborough MA.  Any porter drinker would be pleased with this brew. Upper tier without a doubt!

A: The pour is just about black in color with a finger or so of tan head.

S: Nice chocolate aromas to it to start with, as well as some espresso.  There is a strong roasted malt aroma and perhaps just a hint of soy sauce.  A slight smokiness along with some nut shells.

T: Smokey and roasty, I wasnt quite expecting that.  Not much of the chocolate/cocoa notes that were there on the aroma.  A decent amount of bitterness is also present.  Some toasted nut flavor on the long finish.

M: Medium in body with a smooth, medium carbonation.

O: I could have done without the smoke, but this was a pretty enjoyable beer.
Black in color with a tan head.  Roasted and chocolate notes dominate the aroma and taste.

Black pour with an off beige head. Super thick and roasty with cocoa nib, browning, milk chocolate, and caramel abounding. Not as pronounced as some of their other darker offerings, but pretty damn well done. Thick rich palate with low carbonation and a sweet chalky finish.
12 fl oz bottle at Gråsälstasting. Poured cola in colour with tan head. Strong liquorice in aroma with some roasted coffee notes as well. Quite oily. Strong coffee finish. Quite filling.

Bottle @Gråsälstasting #2. Poured black with a thick brown head. Aroma is liquirice and loads of it.  Roasted malt as well. Flavor is liquirice, roasted malt and coffee. Strong coffee also in the long finish. Lovely porter.

UPDATED: MAY 7, 2012 26th June 2009Opaque black beer. Semi soft and quite a dry palate. Medium roasted malt with a trace of chocolate. A light touch of hops towards the end. Semi bitter aftertaste. Not bad - a grower. Original rating 331st August 2009Tasting at Mes and Sims flat. Opaque black beer. Dry palate. Rich dark malt, chocolate and a little marmite. Finishes soft and dry. Much better than previous sample.

Bottle at Øl & Mat-festivalen, Oslo. Pitch black colour, creamy tan head. Very nice roasty aroma, notes of coffee, dark chocolate and cedar wood. The flavour has also a nice roastiness, notes of coffee and dark chocolate again, hints of liquorice..

Sampled @ Øl & Matfestivalen 2011, Oslo. Pours a near black body with a lasting tanned creamy little head. Aroma is dark roasted malts with some nice chocolate and its really hopy! Medium to light-bodied, softly carbonated and has an oily to watery mouthfeeling. Flavors are mainly strong burned toast with some licorice and mouth-drying hops that ends in a long lasting roasted and bitter finish. Not bad, but I feel it got a bit to dry, light-bodied and the burned toast just got to dominating for my liking.
Bottle.Pitch black colour with beige head.Aroma of salty licorice and coffee nice well balanced with note of dark chocolate and malt,hint of vanilla and cream.

Poured from 12oz bottle, pours black with a nice tan head and lacing through out the entire glass, aroma is full of roasted malt with a backing of chocolate, the flavor has a nice bitterness of  dark chocolate with a kick of coffee as well, this is a all around solid brew.
Bottled at Øl og Mat-festivlaen. Smoke and burned toast. Quite light body. Liquorice.

Pours black with a brown creamy head with somewhat quickly dissipated.  Aroma is chocolate, charcoal and smokeyness.  Taste is sweet with lots of chocolate and coffee bitter coming through, the sweetness drowns out the bitter.  Very light with oily mouthfeel, almost to easy to drink.

Pours a three finger brown head that fades slowly and leaves some lace.  Black color, no highlights, ton of yeast left in bottle.  Good carbonation and medium-heavy bodied. Light coffee nose and flavor is roasted coffee and oak, some bitterness at finish. $2.95 for a 12 oz bottle from Julios Liquors Westborough, Ma.

Gave it a hard pour into a tulip and Wow 2-3" of dark molassas head that, was dense with very tiny bubbles in the carbination, tyhat disapated slowly. The Color was as black as the inside of a cave with the lights out :).

I smell heavily roasted malts, notes of coffee and a fruit(?) very pleasant.

The taste was slightly sweet and bitter at the same time then the bitterness lingered on the back of the tongue like a rich stout would.

The feel of this in my mouth was alot lighter than I was expecting, medium with a slight oiliness to the finish, then it cleans itself out. Amazing. Complex.

Overall pretty good, Ill drink this one a little cooler than I drink most, about 53 F. Ill buy this one again and try it outside in the sun. Its that light and refreshing

12 fl oz bottle, purchased at ØlKonsortiet, Aalborg. Pours a sinfully black body, with a low creamy brown head on top. Initial aroma of heavily roasted/burnt dark malts.  Then a mellowing smell of  chocolate and brown sugar. Medium malt body. Sweetish and roasted/burnt, backed by with a distinct hop bitterness. A certain astringency on the palate. Dries up towards a roasty finish. A rough one.

355ml bottle. Pours nearly jet black with a milk chocolate head that doesnt stick around long. Lots of chocolate on the nose with some licorice and toffee and an earthy hop note. Very chocolaty on the palate with a bitter coffee taste picking up on the mid-palate and flows through a satisfyingly long finish.

A jet black pour with a brown head.  The aroma is filled with chocolate and coffee.  The medium body has an oily texture with average carbonation.  The taste is mildly bitter with a lot of coffee flavor.  A little too much coffee for me in the taste.

12oz bottle from Julios. Bottle acquired 3 months ago.
Appearance : Black with a small brown creamy head. Nice head. No lacing.

Aroma : Great dark chocolate with light coffee. Awesome roasted malt with nice hints of smoke. 

Taste : Roasted malt with light dark fruits. Great light hops with awesome dark chocolate on the finish. Light smoke. Very soft carbonation but its perfect. Silky body. Rich and just thick enough.

Overall : Wow nice surprise there. Awesome body, great finish with nice dark chocolate and light smoke. Great hop presence too. Very well balanced and quite drinkable. No trace of alcohol. Nice light bitterness. Very nice.

SCHIUMA:
color nocciola marcato,  abbondante, fine e media persistenza, anche se un 3 mm di schiuma resistono fino alla fine, rimanendo sul fondo del bicchiere
COLORE:
nero, con leggeri riflessi marroni-rossastri controluce
INTENSITA / FINEZZA / AROMA
profumata, con il tostato in prima linea, che si veste di note di caffè, cioccolato amaro, liquirizia e un sentore di affumicato (ricorda lodore della brace spenta). Una punta di alcohol, mentre i luppoli rimangono mascherati dal forte torrefatto.
GUSTO / RETROGUSTO / PERSISTENZA
da subito la bocca si riempe di sapori tostati, quasi bruciacchiati, ricordando pane bruciato o fondo di caffè. Subentra una leggera acidità che ricorda il cioccolato fondente. Come base un leggero ( ma molto leggero) dolce, che scompare al deglutire, in favore di un amaro torrefatto che si stabilizza a metà della gola. lamaro del luppolo è sfuggente, quasi nullo rispetto alle note precedenti: nessun luppolo americano allorizzonte.

CORPO / CARBONATAZIONE / CONSISTENZA
corpo medio, carbonata il giusto, in bocca da una sensazione oleosa, consistente senza però arrivare ai livelli tipici di imperial stout o baltic porter.
buona, intensa ed interessante. Mio primo prodotto della Dark Horse, sicuramente non lultimo. Si parla di black ale piuttosto che di porter; sinceramente non colgo la sfumatura, assomiglia molto ad altre porter Usa provate e la unica differenza che possono trovare è un torrefatto più accentuato e una mancanza quasi assoluta dei luppoli. Forse questo aspetto la rende un pelino monocorde, e ripetere immediatamente è un compito arduo. qualcuno ha azzardato un parallelismo con una schwartzbier "robusta",.. interessante.

Nose is cardamom, espresso thru heavy roasted malts, then toffee, licorice and medium hoppy finish, feel is elegant and a little on fat side, carb is low, taste is bitter espresso acids, iron, hoppy bitterness throughout and alcohol

Pours black with small dark-brown head. Aroma is malty, caramel, brown sugar, molasses, some hops. Taste is bitter coffee, roasty, a bit of sweetness in the middle and then a rather dry finish. Flavorwise it reminds me of a Schwarzbier only stronger and more assertive. Very smooth mouthfeel.

Bottle. Dark brown  almost black, very small and fully diminishing head. Moderate to full aroma, malty and sweetish, roasted malt and coffee. Body is medium to full, malty and sweetish flavor, roasted malt and coffee, some chocolate. Finish is average, malty and sweetish, coffee and roasted malt. Porter for those who like coffee and sugary sweetness.

Bottle. Pours a pitch black color. Minimal head and small light brown lacing. Carbonation was soft. Aromas and Taste of coffee, chocolate, blueberries, roasted malts, smoked wood, spicy rye, and slight cheese. Beer is very soft on the mouth. Smokey, peppery finish with tons of warming effects. Great porter from Dark Horse.

Pour black with nice brown head. Aroma cereal, grain, roast, chocolate, coffee. Taste super roasty, chocolate, coffee, cereal, grain, quite bitter. MF full body mild fine carb. Very tasty great roast a well balanced porter good stuff.

Reviewed from notes.
Poured into a tulip glass. Color is near black with a light mocha head and not much lacing. Fairly short retention period. Nose brings some complex notes of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, and hints of molasses. The taste is pretty dry with chocolate and roasted malt. Feel is really nice with a good dryness. Drinks quite well and is a nice take on this "style."

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-09-2010

Aspecto: Espumpa persistente de color marrón. La ceveza es negra, opaca. Aroma: tostado, toque, café torrefacto, leve toque ácido. Sabor: Potente. Sabor: Acompaña alaaroma. Un toque de chocolate negro, cacao, torrefacto.Sensació en boca: Potente, untuosa, expansiva, amargor muy persistente agradable en los laterales de la boca.

It is indeed black with a creamy dark tan head. Lots of roast and toffee in the nose. Kind of smells like a Heath Bar. Wrapped in bacon.

Big, bold flavors in the first sip. Dark, bitter chocolate, smoked meat, roasted coffee. Late hop bite, too.

I really dig on this one! 7.5% ABV doesnt hurt, either. As they mention on the site, its not quite a porter, not quite a stout, but golly is it good!

Bottled from Bierkompass. Black as hell with small beige head. Aroma dark chocolate, roasted malt. Taste, lot of coffee, hints of carame and, grapefruit in background. Nice,long bitter finish. Very nice.

Bottle 355ml at Beer2000 courtesy of gunnfryd. Pours black with a dense dark tan head. Aroma is dark chocolate, coffee, roastiness. Taste is medium bitter, very light sweet. Medium body, oily, soft carbonation. Too much dominated by dark chocolate which threw this brew off balance for me.

Bottle 355ml @ Beer2000
[Courtesy of gunnfryd] Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate and coffee. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter with a long chocolate finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Pikimusta olut. Vaalean ruskea vaahto. Tuoksussa on leipää, suklaata, lakritsia, grillattua porsasta, laktisuutta ja etenkin kahvia. Maku on katkera, kuivan kahvinen ja salmiakkinen. Suutuntuma on porterille erittäin runsas ja öljyinen. Saakelin nautinnollinen olut ja kuulluu portereiden parhaimmistoon.

Pours dark brown with a brown head. The aroma is very nice with coffee and milk chocolate. The flavor is rich with roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, and light hints of raisins. Perfect silky mouthfeel and potent flavors without being too over the top. Well balanced as well, with a nice roasted/bitter finish. This is one of those beers that reminds me why I love this style.

12 oz. bottle from Oades Big Ten

Ar: Awesome bitter chocolate nose with a subtle touch of coffee.
Ap:  Pours a deep black with a 1" cinnamon head that lasts a while.
T:  Roasty flavor with notes of coffee and chocolate.  Flavor actually doesnt stand up to the lovely rich aroma.
P: Medium body but a little over carbonated for my tastes when it comes to a black ale/porter.

O: Solid beer.  A bit of a letdown though.

It pours a motor oil black with not much head and poor lacing.

The aroma is ok but nothing special. There are notes of coffee and light hops.

The taste is just bad. Its light coffee, but this beer doesnt know what it wants to be. Its certainly not an american stong ale. Its in between a porter and imperial stout.

Thick, almost oily black-black beer. Very beautiful, stable cappuccino foam. Roasted malt and resin in the nose. In the mouth a little licorice and grapefruit. Great mouthfeel. Bitterness fills the mouth full. Violently intense, yet smooth. Inspirational.

Poured from 12 oz gift of eBeerSnob, thanks.   Very heavy, dark, viscous liquid with orange head that seemed to dissapate too quickly.  Strong chocolate and coffee flavors.  For my taste a good blend of hops to malt, no too sweet and not IPA bitter.  Sipped slowly and enjoyed like a fine cigar.  Not sold in my state, but could easily fit into my "wish list" for traveling beer friends.
Dark, meaty, delicious. A very good american porter with was great on Christmas day.

Draught at Bishops Arms, Järntorget. 
Really black colour with poor bubbly head. Soft body with subtle notes of vanilla and dark berries. Toast is just in the background. Light toasty in flavour, but burnt with a lot of hops. Soft mouthfeel with high bitterness. Rich hoppy but balanced.

Tap at Churchkey. The pour is a clear deep red with large bubbles forming but no head. Aroma is muted but there is some vinegar, feet, smoke. Very odd combo. Taste is bland, neutral, watery and basically bitter. Really tasted like nothing. Very poor keg Im assuming or maybe it just normally sucks.

Pours pitch black with a small and deep rusty brown head.  Roasty aroma of coffee and burnt wood with notes of molasses.  Warm coffee flavor with dark chocolate.  Medium to full bodied with a lingering warmth and bitterness.  Very nice.  This is definitely one of my top porters.
UPDATED: JUN 1, 2011 Roasted smoothness, this porter is in perfect harmony with malts, hops, and alcohol, you cannot tell its 7.5% another good beer from Dark Horse

This is really, really good stuff. Im not entirely sure how its not a stout or porter, but strong ales can mean pretty much anything, so whatever.

Pours black as night without much of a head at all. You can smell some coffee, honey, and a bit of smoke. The taste is coffee and chocolate w/ a bit of burnt (good burnt, not bad). Mouthfeel is medium. A good amount of carbonation w/o being over the top. Im used to beers this color being like syrup. Definitely not the case here. Overall, a great, drinkable beer. Whatever style it is, its good. Id put it in the porter or stout category, but its irrelevant at the end of the day.

Serving type: bottle

Pours dark brown/black with a thin brown coffee-colored head that dissipated fully. Aroma is a wonderful mix of dark fruit (plums/dates), sweet malt, roast coffee, molasses, and bitter dark chocolate. Tastes of coffee, bitter hops, dark chocolate, and a touch of sweetness. Finishes quite dry.
Bottle. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is apple, coffee, chocolate, hop, malt. flavour is apple, coffee, chocolate, hop, malt, licorice. Very nice beer.

(bottle, 5/5/10). Black color. Medium dark tan head, which is mostly diminishing. Moderate roasted malt aroma. Strong roasted malt flavor, with light charcoal. Long duration. Light bitter finish with lasting roastiness. Thin/slick texture. Soft carbonation. Spare lacing.

I beleive this bottle came from wnoble, thanks.  Clear black pour, fizzy light tan head.  Chocolate, lightly roasted malts, a bit of coffee, some what dry, with some fruit.  A nice beer, glad to have tried it.
This was a very dark beer that had a nice aroma of chocolate and smoke. Good finish through eith nice alcohol.

(12oz bottle courtesy of guy in chicago!).  Pours black with khaki head.  Aroma of chocolate and berries and pine.  Taste is roasty bitter to along with hop bitterness and a little bit of sweetness.  Thin bodied with a creamy texture.  Finish is bitter.  I would like this more if it were hopped less.

On bottle at Blind Bobs.  Aroma is the best of this beer.  Roasted Malts dominates on the nose, accompanied by espresso, hazelnuts, and dark chocolate.  The taste greatly improved as it warmed.  At first it tasted watery, but grew with flavor over time.  This beer is equivalent to a triple chocolate cake for desert.  Bon apetit.

Big robust coffee flavors and nose..  black appearance with brownish head and good lacing.  good carbonation and mouthfeel.  coffee bitter extreme--huge porter--could use a little sweetness IMO.  Overall a very good extreme brew.

Bottle, a very kind extra courtesy of HopBurp.  Thanks man!  Pours dark, dark brown, pretty much black, with a 2-finger dark brown head.  Aromas of dark chocolate, cherry, honey, brown sugar, and a hint of coffee.  The flavor is espresso, bitter cocoa powder, bitter dark chocolate, and some spicy grassy hops.  The aftertaste is chocolate with slight vanilla.  Creamy, medium body and carbonation, and dry.  Very good beer, nice and robust.  This drinks like a stout.

Bottle poured a translucent dark reddish brown nearly black with a lasting creamy brown head. Aromas of roasted malt, charcoal, bakers cocoa and a hint of licorice. Palate was medium bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of roasted malt, bakers cocoa and light licorice with a smooth dry lingering roasty finish,
12oz bottle thanks to HopBurp. Pours black with a dark brown head. Nose is coffee, roasted malts and dark fruit. Flavor is coffee, real roasty, chocolate and with a bitter finish. Nice beer.

Flaske 12 Oz. Mørkebrun til sort hælde, lidt tynd, men meget smukt cremet brunt hvede. Aroma af Kvalitets kaffe og chokolade. Glad smag og næsten fløjeslagtig mundfornemmelse. Smagen fortsætter i en tør mund fornemmelse med en lang eftersmag af kaffe. Stort set alt i alt alt, det man kan forlange af en porter.

37,5 cl bottle. Pours very dark, opaque black body with a beautiful light brown head. Light toasty aroma of chocolate and coffee. Dense and powerful flavor with lots of roast, chocolate, coffee, tobacco, and smoke. Long bitter finish. Massive body with light carbonation. A wonderful surprise!

Beautiful rich dark khaki head.  Roasty aroma with dark cherry juice.  Tastes medium sweet and medium bitter with a perfect touch of sour.  Vanilla, bitter roasted malts.  Lively carbonation.  Excellent porter.

Bottle at Monks Porterhouse.
Pours brown with a small beige head.
Taste of milk chocolate with some red berries. Very well balanced.

Tap at RnH: Pours an opaque with a deep dark khaki head. Fudgey chewy dark malt aroma- pretty clean and nice roast. Nice silky body- would be incredible on cask. Nice rich chocolate malt flavor. Smooth roast- long cohesive flavors. A nice Porter.

Bottle, 12oz. Definitely on the black side this one, both aroma-, appearance- and flavorwise. Its oily on the pour, black in the body and the only thing preventing it from a perfect five is the minimal sized tan head. Coffee, dark chocolate and some hints of licorice blends nicely in the aroma. The flavor is nice too, but not at the same level although quite similar. On the dark, malty side that is. Bitter, roasted finish, almost ashtray-like. A bit thin on the body, else fine on the palate. A rather lovely beer that needs more body. 100917

Poured from a 12oz bottle. Not surprising, it pours almost black with a nice amount of tan head.  Smell is bittersweet chocolate and burnt sugar.  Taste is dark chocolate, some coffee and lots of hoppiness in the back end.

Bottle brought back from Michigan by my buddy Finchy. F-I-N-C-H-Y! Darn tasty beer. Love it, wish we could get this out here in the NW. I think Michigan is catching up to Oregon for Craft Beer quality.

Bottle; Pour is perfect; dark brown with tan head. Nice retention, modest lacing. Aromas are roasty chocolate malts. Flavors are slightly bitter, nice and sweet, coffee, chocolate, roasty malts with a hint of hop bitterness. This is everything you would want out of a porter.

12oz. bottle. Pgh, PA. Poured black. Extra Tan, fluffy head. Aroma malty, coffee, chocolate, and sweet. Flavor spicy up front. Vanilla, coffee, chocolate, and licorice. Tasted more hops as the beer warmed. Medium bodied. Lingering aftertaste. nicely balanced. Lots of carbonation.

12oz bottle. Pours a black body with a finger-width, dense and frothy, brown head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing throughout. Aroma is deep roasts, soft and creamy chocolates, caramel and molasses, fresh coffee, nuts, a touch of vanilla and biscuit, and a few dark fruits. I get just a hint of grassy hop as this warms a bit more too. Really nice aroma. Flavor is very roasty with some char, bittersweet chocolates, piney hops, coffee, nuts, caramel and molasses, and a light licorice. Finishes dry, hoppy, and roasty with a touch of sharpness. Medium, bright bitterness accentuated by the very dry, somewhat charred roasts. Very clean though.
