Okay, I think I was spoiled by the first beer I tried of theirs, Trois Blueberry stout.  This beer is almost identical in flavor, and very good I may add, but lacks the blueberries, of course.  Its black, oily, and goes down quite well.  Im liking this brewery more and more.

black colour, fine creamy head, deep coffey aroma, blackberries, black chocolate, cinnamon, roasted, oily, full-bodied, sweet with a strong bitterness, the finish is long, coffeish and bitter - a monument ! - Thanks to PsychProf for this great beer !

Wow - very dark color - motor oil like. Pours with tightly carbonated very dark borwn head - one of the darkest heads Ive seen. Bakers chocolate and hoppy nose - smells like a porter to me. Chewy palate - thick. BIG, HUGE flavors of bittersweet/dark chocolate, roasted/burnt coffee and bitter hoppy notes. Tastes like a West Coat hoppy porter to me. This beer has huge flavors which I like, but is a bit over-the-top in terms of its bitterness. Still, give it props for the bold flavor profile.

I definitely agree with this beers characterization as a Porter, despite the bottle calling it a black bier ale.  The roastiness, bitterness and thickness of the malt bely its true nature.  But I beg to differ with Joe (user_experience) about the hand-drawn dark horse on the label.  It is my studied belief that the equine animal in question is indeed a horse - just one with particularly long ears.  Only the artist knows for sure.  As for the beer, its BITTER.  Moreso than a lot of porters, so it surprised me a tad.  A quality malty brew thats almost in stout territory.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2003 Rerate: I have to refine my feelings on this one after repeated retastings. The aroma is fairly standard for a good porter; more roasty than sweet. The taste, however, has distinct development. It starts chocolate sweet, but not syrupy, for just a short time, than turns roasted, then some hops and dark maltiness come in. Long lasting, lip smacking finish, with some back of throat stickiness that would usually detract, but doesn't somehow. Original: 12/14/01: The rating here is an average of the bottled version and the on tap version I had on a great trip to the brewery with Hennes. In bottle, the brew was fine, nice malts and molasses notes. On tap, chocolate came through more strongly, yet everything was very balanced. Good body/mouthfeel. Oh, and I got a personalized Three Floyds sampler six along with this beer and the Boffo Brown. What a great day!
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Black in color. Very roasty and bitter. Also a bit fruity. Much like a stout.

Looks like Im the only person to rate this beer so far that didnt get the beer from PsychProf besides Hennes. Thats because I got it from Hennes. Not a bad beer. Theres actually a lot of citrusy hops for a porter since the darker, maltier beers tend to just eat the hop flavors and you can really pick them up in this beer. On the appearance, it really comes closer to a stout than a porter, but the flavor and aroma really fit in with the porter style. This beer gives me the impression that this brewery could really do some good stuff.

The dark horse is actually a hand-drawn ass on the label. Very black 26+ SPN, chocolate-colored sparkling foam, roasty and a mite lactic, particulate feel, some light fruity/yeasty esters. Lasting deep carmels and a bit of bitter licorice. Much thanks to Psych_Prof!

Dark as midnight with a gorgeous brown head. Nose is filled with dark/roasty malts,subtle chocolate and coffee notes. Medium to full bodied with definite porter/stout qualites. Smooth malts laced with chocolate along with strong hopping making for a powerful bitterness.(Maybe a bit too much?)  Good stuff. Thank you psychprof.

Extremely black. Very roasty, very malty, very bitter. Full bodied with salty licorice flavour. Is this a schwarzbier on steroids or baltic style porter? Id say the latter, but in any case it is a good beer.
Thanks PsychProf for sending me this rare beer!

This is the best Dark Horse brew that Ive tried - very rich with caramel and especially nice roasty accents.  The high ABV is noticeable, but in a spicy, dark and warm accent way.  Well done!

Added comment: My original review was for the draft version - in the bottle all the other flavours succumb to the huge roasted flavour, which is fine by me, as I love the taste, but may turn others away.
